Shipment Creation Rules This topic briefly explains how the system creates shipments for sales orders depending on the shipping rules specified in these orders, and how you can consolidate shipments for multiple sales orders. Shipment Creation by Shipping Rules Each shipment is generated from one particular warehouse. The system creates an individual shipment from each warehouse that is specified in sales order lines, as if these were multiple orders being shipped from different warehouses. If you are creating shipments by processing orders on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO501000|SO501000]) Process Orders (SO501000) form, the system creates the shipments one by one from each warehouse that is referred to in each processed order. The document-level shipping rule of the sales order, which is specified on the Shipping Settings tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Ordersform (SO301000), is applied to each warehouse as follows: If the document-level shipping rule is Ship Complete , a shipment is created from the warehouse selected in the line only if all other order lines with the same warehouse can be shipped from that warehouse according to the shipping rule of each line. Ship Complete lines can be shipped in full, and other lines can be shipped at least partially. If the document-level shipping rule is Cancel Remainder or Back-Order Allowed , a shipment is created from the selected warehouse if at least one order line can be shipped from that warehouse according to the shipping rule of the line. When a shipment is created for a sales order, the system adds the lines with a nonzero open quantity to the shipment according to the following logic: The system adds to the shipment only the lines that have a Ship On date no later than the specified shipment date and have to be shipped from the warehouse specified for the shipment. The system adds the lines to the shipment according to the shipping rule of the line as follows: A Ship Complete line is added to the shipment only if the open quantity can be shipped in full from the quantity available for shipping. A Back Order Allowed or Cancel Remainder line is added to the shipment with the quantity that is available for shipping at the moment of shipment creation even if the quantity is less than the open quantity of the line. For more detailed information on shipping rules, see Shipping Rule Combinations. Consolidated Shipments You can consolidate shipments, creating one shipment (and corresponding shipment document) for multiple sales orders of the same customer, unless the Ship Separately check box on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO201000|SO201000]) Order Types (SO201000) form is selected for the order type being used. As long as the check box is cleared, you can use the ([~/?ScreenId=SO501000|SO501000]) Process Orders (SO501000) form to create one shipment for multiple sales orders associated with the same customer. Sales orders with the predefined order type SO don't require goods to be shipped separately for separate sales orders. The orders of the type for which the Ship Separately check box is selected can still be consolidated into a single shipment if you manually add them using the Add Order button on the Document Details tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO302000|SO302000]) Shipments (SO302000) form. One more setting that affects the creation of consolidated shipments is the Use Customer's Account setting specified in a shipment document on the Shipment Settings tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO302000|SO302000]) Shipments (SO302000) form. The system copies the state of this check box from the related sales order. Thus, if you mass-process multiple sales orders that have different states of the Use Customer's Account check box on the Shipping Settings tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form, the system will group the sales orders by the state of this check box and create two consolidated shipments: The first shipment will include the sales orders in which the check box is selected, and the second shipment will include the sales orders in which this check box is cleared.

Shipment Processing Steps Shipments, which are a key part of the order fulfillment process, can be incoming or outgoing. This topic discusses the outgoing shipments (based on the Issue operation) that are generated when a user processes a sale of items and ships the items to a customer; further we will refer to them as shipments . The processing of incoming shipments (which are based on the Receipt operation, and thus are called receipts ) involve customer returns based on return orders and is described in the topics of the Processing Customer Returns section. For a shipment prepared for a sales order, the typical processing involves the actions and generated documents shown in the following diagram. Shipment process The following sections describe in detail the processing steps shown in the diagram. 1. Prepare the Shipment You can directly create a shipment document for a particular sales order on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form by selecting Actions Create Shipment on the form toolbar; this brings up the ([~/?ScreenId=SO302000|SO302000]) Shipments (SO302000) form with the new shipment document that includes the lines with items to be shipped. Alternatively, by using the ([~/?ScreenId=SO302000|SO302000]) Shipments form as a starting point, you can create a new shipment document and add one order or multiple orders of the same customer. To create multiple shipments for multiple sales orders of multiple customers, you use the ([~/?ScreenId=SO501000|SO501000]) Process Orders (SO501000) form. The system automatically assigns reference numbers to the created shipment documents, in accordance with the numbering sequence assigned to shipments on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO101000|SO101000]) Sales Orders Preferences (SO101000) form. If you use the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders form to create shipments for a sales order that includes items to be shipped from multiple warehouses, you can create only one shipment at a time. Because an order with the Shipping status is read-only, there can be only one open shipment for the order from a particular warehouse. Once you confirm the open shipment, you can create a shipment to be sent from another warehouse. However, by using the ([~/?ScreenId=SO501000|SO501000]) Process Orders form, you can create multiple shipments for these orders at once. 2. Print the Pick List You can print a pick list for a particular shipment by using the ([~/?ScreenId=SO302000|SO302000]) Shipments (SO302000) form. For multiple shipments with the On Hold or Open status, you can print pick lists by using the ([~/?ScreenId=SO503000|SO503000]) Process Shipments (SO503000) form. For more details, see Shipment Processing Steps. 3. Confirm the Shipment After all the required goods are picked and packed, you can confirm the shipment by clicking Actions Confirm Shipment on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO302000|SO302000]) Shipments (SO302000) form. You can confirm multiple shipments by executing the Confirm Shipment action for the selected shipments on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO503000|SO503000]) Process Shipments (SO503000) form. Shipment confirmation updates the available quantities and changes the status of the associated sales order. During shipment confirmation, the system checks that for all items for which lot or serial numbers are tracked, the appropriate numbers were specified. 4. Print Shipment Confirmation If authorization is required before the shipment is confirmed, you can print a shipment confirmation document to be signed by the authorized person by clicking Reports > Print Shipment Confirmation on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO302000|SO302000]) Shipments (SO302000) form. For multiple shipments, you can print shipment confirmations by using the ([~/?ScreenId=SO503000|SO503000]) Process Shipments (SO503000) form. To complete the sale, you must generate Sales Orders invoices and inventory issues and release these documents. The general workflow for most organizations is to first generate Sales Orders invoices and then release them; on release of these invoices, inventory issues are generated automatically. Another shipment processing workflow, in which an organization updates inventory and processes inventory issues before generating and processing customer invoices, is described in Shipment Process Variations. 5. Correct the Shipment If you need to correct a shipment that has already been confirmed, click Actions Correct Shipment on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO302000|SO302000]) Shipments (SO302000) form to reopen the shipment and make the required corrections. The associated order's status is changed to Shipping once you reopen the shipment. If an order that has a confirmed shipment has been canceled, you can reopen the order by clicking Actions Re-Open Order on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form. You can then delete or correct the shipment by using the ([~/?ScreenId=SO302000|SO302000]) Shipments form. If a shipment includes a sales order line that is also included in any subsequent shipments, you have to correct the subsequent shipments prior to correcting the preceding one. After you have completed all needed corrections, you can confirm the shipment or shipments that you have reopened. Shipment Process Variations Due to shipment policies, your organization may process customer invoices later than it does inventory issues. In this case, you can first create issues, then generate invoices, and finally release invoices and issues. The processing of a sales order with issues created before invoices includes the steps and generated documents shown in the following diagram. The following sections describe in detail the processing steps shown in the diagram. 1. Enter the Sales Order You create a new sales order is created on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form. If the order is created with the On Hold status, you should clear the Hold check box for the order to process it further. For details on the settings to be specified in the order, see Sales Order Entry. 2. Prepare and Confirm the Shipment For a particular order, you can create a shipment by clicking Actions Create Shipment on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form. Then you need to confirm the shipment. For more details, see Shipment Processing Steps. 3. Update Inventory To manually create the inventory issue for a shipment, you can click Actions Create Shipment on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO302000|SO302000]) Shipments (SO302000) form, or you can create inventory issues for multiple selected shipments by executing the Update IN action on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO503000|SO503000]) Process Shipments (SO503000) form. 4. Release the Inventory Issue To release the inventory issue (and thus, to update the item availability information in inventory), you click Actions > Release on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=IN302000|IN302000]) Issues (IN302000) form. When the inventory issue is released, the batch of General Ledger transactions is generated. 5. Process the Sales Orders Invoice You can prepare a Sales Orders (SO) invoice for a particular order by clicking Actions Prepare Invoice on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO302000|SO302000]) Shipments (SO302000) form, or you can create invoices for multiple selected shipments by executing the Prepare Invoice action on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO503000|SO503000]) Process Shipments (SO503000) form. To release the SO invoice, you click Actions > Release on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices (SO303000) form after reviewing its details. When the SO invoice is released, the batch of General Ledger transactions is generated. To adjust the dates in the invoices generated for confirmed shipments, you can use the Use Shipment Date for Invoice Date check box on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO101000|SO101000]) Sales Orders Preferences (SO101000) form as follows: Select this check box to set the shipment date as the invoice date. Clear the check box to use the current business date as the default date for the invoice.

Shipping Rule Combinations The shipping rules specified for a particular sales order define how the goods in the sales order should be shipped—whether they should be shipped only in full or partial shipments for the available quantities are allowed. The shipment rules for a sales order are applied when you create a shipment for a single order—by using the Create Shipment action on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form—or mass-create shipments for multiple orders, by running the Create Shipments process from the ([~/?ScreenId=SO501000|SO501000]) Process Orders (SO501000) form. Shipping Rule Options On the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form, you can specify the document-level shipping rule for the sales order document as a whole (in the Shipping Rule box on the Shipping Settings tab) and for each sales order line (in the Shipping Rule column on the Document Details tab). You can specify any of the following shipping rule options for order lines and for orders: Ship Complete Cancel Remainder Back Order Allowed The shipping rules applied to order lines are explained in the following table. Line-Level Shipping Rules Shipping Rule Option Result Ship Complete If a negative quantity is not allowed for the item specified in the line, the item can be included in a shipment only if the full ordered quantity is available for shipping. If the quantity of the item that is available for shipping is less than the ordered quantity, then the item in this line is not included in the shipment. The ordered quantity is shown as the Open Quantity , and the line remains Open . If shipping of the negative stock is allowed for the order type—that is, if Ship in Full If Negative Stock Is Allowed is selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO201000|SO201000]) Order Types (SO201000) form—the items for which a negative quantity is allowed are included in a shipment in the full ordered quantity, regardless of whether this quantity is available for shipping. (This rule does not apply to lot- or serial-tracked stock items.) After this shipment has been confirmed, the line has the Completed status on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders form. For details, see Shipment of Ordered Items. Cancel Remainder With this shipping rule, shipping for the line is performed only once. If a negative quantity is not allowed for the item specified in the line, the item can be included in a shipment if any nonzero quantity that is less than or equal to the ordered quantity is available for shipping. If shipping of the negative stock is allowed for the order type, the items for which a negative quantity is allowed are included in a shipment in the full ordered quantity, regardless of whether it is available for shipping. (This rule does not apply to lot- or serial-tracked stock items.) After this shipment has been confirmed, the line is marked as Completed , and the Open Quantity value is set to zero. If you reopen a sales order line for which at least one shipment has been performed, the system changes the shipping rule to Back-Order Allowed for this line on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders form. Back Order Allowed If a negative quantity is not allowed for the item specified in the line, the item can be included in a shipment if any nonzero quantity that is less than or equal to the ordered quantity is available for shipping. The remaining quantity (if applicable) is shown as the Open Quantity on the line. The ordered quantity can be shipped in multiple shipments. The line gets the Completed status once the full ordered quantity has been shipped. If shipping of the negative stock is allowed for the order type, the items for which a negative quantity is allowed are included in a shipment in the full ordered quantity, regardless of whether the full quantity is available for shipping. (This rule does not apply to lot- or serial-tracked stock items.) After this shipment has been confirmed, the line has the Completed status. If shipping of the negative stock is not allowed for an order type, but you don't want to rely completely on availability data for the classes of items for which negative quantity is allowed, select the Add Zero Lines for Items Not in Stock check box on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO101000|SO101000]) Sales Orders Preferences form. Then in the orders of this type, for order lines with the Back Order Allowed shipping rule, a zero-quantity line is added to the shipment if the item is not in stock; you can manually enter the actually available quantity of the item. See the table below for details about how the shipping rule of a sales order affects the mass-processing of the sales orders, which you perform by using the ([~/?ScreenId=SO501000|SO501000]) Process Orders (SO501000) form. If you initiate shipment creation for an individual sales order (by using the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders form) and the system detects a shortage of the items, the system displays the message informing you that the order cannot be shipped in full so that you can make an appropriate decision on the fulfillment of this order and change the quantities, create a partial shipment, or change the order status to Back Order manually. Document-Level Shipping Rules Document-Level Rule Result Ship Complete If shipping cannot be performed for each line of the order, no shipment is created, and the order is assigned the Back Order status. The shipment is created (and the order is assigned the Shipping status) if shipping can be performed for each line—that is, if the lines meet the following criteria: For each Ship Complete line: The ordered quantity is available for shipping and can be shipped in full. For each Cancel Remainder line: Any nonzero quantity that is equal to or less than the ordered quantity is available for shipping. For each Back Order Allowed line: Any nonzero quantity that is equal to or less than the ordered quantity is available for shipping. You cannot specify different Requested On dates for different lines in the order. When the shipment has been confirmed, the order is assigned the Completed status if all the lines have the Completed status. If any line is not completed, the order is assigned the Back Order status. Cancel Remainder If shipping cannot be performed for any of order lines, no shipment is created, and the order is assigned the Back Order status. If full or partial shipping can be performed for at least one line (according to the line's shipping rule), the shipment is created. You cannot specify different Requested On dates for different lines in the order. When the shipment has been confirmed, the order is assigned the Completed status if at least one line has the Completed status and the lines not included in shipment have the Cancel Remainder rule. The order is assigned the Back Order status if at least one line is not completed (that is, if it has a nonzero open quantity). Back Order Allowed If shipping cannot be performed for any of the order lines, no shipment is created, and the order is assigned the Back Order status. You can specify different Requested On dates for different lines in the order, and different lines will be shipped on different dates. If you change the Requested On date for the order, the system prompts you to choose whether you want to keep the dates specified for each line or to update the respective dates with the new Requested On date. If full or partial shipping can be performed for at least one line according to the line's shipping rule, the shipment is created. After the shipment has been confirmed, the order is assigned the Back Order status if other lines are not completed. Shipment Thresholds You can use undershipment and overshipment thresholds, in addition to shipping rules, to determine whether a shipment results in changing the status of the sales order line to Completed . On the Document Details tab on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form, for each line of a sales order, you can specify whether undershipment and overshipment are allowed as follows: To allow overshipment, you enter in the Overship. Threshold (%) column a value greater than 100 (meaning 100%). For an order line with the Ship Complete shipping rule for 100 yards of fabric, you might opt to have the whole lap shipped (a lap of fabric has 100 meters, and each meter is 1.093 yards). To do this, you can specify the overshipment threshold at 110%, which allows up to 10% more fabric than the ordered amount to be shipped. To allow undershipment, you enter in the Undership. Threshold (%) a value that is less than 100. Suppose that when you create a shipment, for an order line with the Back Order Allowed shipping rule, the system detects a small shortage of goods—for example, only 99 units are available for shipping and 100 have been ordered. If the line's undershipment threshold was specified at 99% or lower, the 99 units for the line will be included in the shipment, the line will be marked as Completed , and no open quantity will be left on the line for a back order. If 100 is specified in both these columns, it means that undershipment or overshipment are not allowed. Partial Shipping of Orders When you create a shipment for a sales order (by using either ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders or ([~/?ScreenId=SO501000|SO501000]) Process Orders form), the system checks the availability of the items included in the sales order and uses the shipping rules to determine whether the shipment can be created. This topic describes how the partial shipments are created and processed, and how to add zero lines for the items that currently are not available for shipment. Shipping of Stock Items in Parts You can create partial shipments for the sales orders if the Shipping Rule box on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form has the Back Order Allowed option selected and Back Order Allowed shipping rule is selected for at least one order line. These settings let you ship the available quantity of goods in one shipment and the remainder in one shipment or multiple shipments as the goods are received. If the Cancel Remainder shipping rule is specified in a line, shipping for the line is performed only once. After the partial shipment of available items has been prepared and confirmed, the line is completed, and the open quantity of the line is set to zero. The lines with the Ship Complete shipping rule cannot be shipped partially. For more information on shipping rules, overshipment, and undershipment, see Shipping Rule Combinations. When you create a shipment by using the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders form, if the system detects that no shipment can be created according to the shipment rules (due to a shortage of items), the system displays a warning; you then decide how to process the order further. If you mass-create shipments for multiple sales orders from the ([~/?ScreenId=SO501000|SO501000]) Process Orders form, and the system detects that no shipment can be created for a particular order according to the shipment rules, the system changes the status of the order to Back Order . For information, on how to replan back-orders, see Back Ordering and Replanning Back Orders. Partial Shipping of Free Items If a sales order is fulfilled with multiple partial shipments, the Free Item Shipping setting, located on the Price/Discount Calculation tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO101000|SO101000]) Sales Orders Preferences (SO101000) form, defines how free items should be shipped: proportionally to the amounts of goods in the partial shipments ( Proportional ), or sent with the last shipment ( On Last Shipment ). If free items are sent with the last shipment and only part of the needed quantity of free items is available, only the available quantity is shipped, and no back order is initiated for the missing free items. If the quantity of the free items should be distributed between the partial shipments, the total quantity of free items on all partial shipments for the order may be less than the quantity initially calculated for the applicable group discount, because the system rounds the free item quantity down on each partial shipment. In such a case, you can add the missing quantity of the free item manually to any of the partial shipments. Shipments With Zero Lines Your organization may prefer to send customer invoices that list all the items from their sales orders so that they can see which items were ordered but at the time were unavailable. To allow the system to add these zero lines to shipments, select the Add Zero Lines for Items Not in Stock check box on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO101000|SO101000]) Sales Orders Preferences form. Selecting this option also can be helpful if you don't want to rely completely on availability data, because in some cases, although the system shows an item as not in stock, the quantities required for a shipment may be available for some reason. You should select this check box if you have item classes for items of which negative quantities are allowed and if shipments are created manually on a per-order basis—then users can edit the shipments and specify the quantities that are currently not reflected on the books correctly and may be available on shipment confirmation (for instance, if shown as quantities on purchase receipts). For example, if you prepare a shipment for a sales order with a line that have the Back Order Allowed shipping rule, and the available quantity of the item is zero, the shipment will include a zero-line for this item, if the Add Zero Lines for Items Not in Stock is selected. You can then correct the quantity tho specify the quantity that is actually available for this order line. If the Add Zero Lines for Items Not in Stock check box is selected, you should also decide whether to allow the creation of shipments with all zero-quantity lines. To allow the creation of such shipments, you should select the Create Zero Shipments check box on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO101000|SO101000]) Sales Orders Preferences form. However, we do not recommend using this option if in your organization, shipments are generally created automatically by using the ([~/?ScreenId=SO501000|SO501000]) Process Orders form.

Back Ordering and Replanning Back Orders This topic explains when the system back-orders a sales order and how to replan a back order to process it further. Completing Sales Orders Lines on Shipping Lines with stock and non-stock items that require shipping are completed based on the item quantity in the shipments prepared for the sales order. When you confirm a shipment of the full open quantity of an order line, the Completed check box becomes selected in the order line. Non-stock lines that do not require shipping are completed by the prepared invoice. After all lines have been completed, the order is assigned the Completed status. When you confirm a partial shipment, if an open Ship Complete line or an incomplete Back Order Allowed line remains in the order, the remaining open quantity of the line becomes classified to the SO Back Ordered allocation type, and the sales order is assigned the Back Order status. The open quantities of Cancel Remainder lines are set to zero and the Completed check box is selected for the lines. Sales order lines that require shipping but cannot be shipped at the moment are assigned the SO Back Ordered allocation type if shipment creation has failed for them. For an individual sales order with the Back Order status, you can create a shipment directly from the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form without replanning the order once the quantities of the items become above zero. To be able to mass-prepare shipments for back orders by using the Create Shipment action on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO501000|SO501000]) Process Orders (SO501000) form, you need to replan the back orders. Automatic Replanning of Back Orders Replanning of a back order is a process that moves the ordered items with the SO Back Ordered allocation type to the SO Booked allocation type and changes the status of the back order to Open so that it can be shipped. You can make the system auto-replan back orders by selecting the Replan Back-Orders check box on the ([~/?ScreenId=IN101000|IN101000]) Inventory Preferences (IN101000) form. If this check box is selected, the system automatically replans back orders on release of every inventory transaction that increases the inventory on hand (inventory receipt, inventory transfer, or positive inventory adjustment). The system performs the replanning process for the items that are involved in the released inventory transactions. Manual Replanning of Back Orders If automatic replanning is switched off— that is, if the Replan Back-Orders check box is cleared on the ([~/?ScreenId=IN101000|IN101000]) Inventory Preferences (IN101000) form— you can run the manual replanning process for the needed inventory items from the ([~/?ScreenId=IN505000|IN505000]) Validate Inventory (IN505000) form with the Replan Back Orders check box selected. Also, you can configure a schedule to run the process on that form at an appropriate interval, such as once a day. Back Order Replanning Process When automatic replanning is in process, for each inventory item being processed, the system selects the SO Booked and SO Back Ordered lines of open sales orders. The selected lines are sorted by Ship On date (starting from the earliest one), allocation type ( SO Booked lines are organized before SO Back Ordered lines), and line quantity, starting from the greatest quantity. SO Booked lines are included in the process to make sure that the units that are booked for orders created earlier are not counted for the fulfillment of back orders created later. The system distributes the quantity available for shipping among the selected lines in their sort order as follows: The quantities of SO Booked lines are subtracted from the quantity available for shipping that can be distributed to the next lines. If there is some quantity available for shipping that can be distributed to an SO Back Ordered line, the system changes the allocation type of the line to SO Booked . For lines with the Ship Complete shipping rule, the system changes the allocation type to SO Booked only if the line quantity can be booked in full. If the quantity available for shipping is not enough to distribute among all the selected lines, the remaining lines maintain the original SO Back Ordered status. Each processed line is replanned in full or not replanned at all (and never split) if the quantity that can be booked for the line is less than the line quantity. The system does not reallocate items when it replans back orders. For each replanned back order of an order type that requires allocation—that is, if the Require Stock Allocation check box is selected for the order type on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO201000|SO201000]) Order Types (SO201000) form—you have to manually allocate items before further processing the order.

An invoice is a legally binding document that records the price and details of the sale and indicates that the order has been fulfilled. By the time an invoice is created for a sales order, the goods or services have been delivered or rendered; if some changes in the sale have occurred, you may need to reflect these changes directly in the invoice by editing it. The following types of documents can be processed by using the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SO_30_30_00|Invoices] ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000])form: [anchor|#ul_sdm_sh3_mdb] *Invoices *Cash sales *Cash returns *Credit memos
The sections below describe how different types of invoices created in the Sales Orders module are processed. {br}{TOC} ==Sales Orders Invoices and Accounts Receivable Invoices== After you have prepared and confirmed the shipment of items, you need to bill the customer for the sold items. For a sales order, you prepare a Sales Orders (SO) invoice, which can be reviewed on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SO_30_30_00|Invoices] ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) form. On release of the SO invoice, the system creates an Accounts Receivable (AR) invoice that is related to the SO invoice and has the same reference number. This AR invoice becomes available for reviewing and further processing on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\AR_30_10_00|Invoices and Memos] ([~/?ScreenId=AR301000|AR301000]). {br}
An AR invoice is a financial document that doesn’t have information about freight details. This information, along with links to shipments and sales orders, is provided in the SO invoice. The reference number assigned to the SO and AR invoices is printed in the customer statement so that these invoices appear to be a single document from the customer’s perspective. The AR invoice is released on the release of the SO invoice (that is, the AR invoice is released as soon as it is created); the link to the created batch of the generated General Ledger transactions can be found in both of these documents. ==Invoice Processing== You can prepare an invoice for a sales order that has been shipped or does not require shipping, or you can prepare an invoice for a shipment. Also, you can mass-prepare invoices from orders or shipments on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SO_50_10_00|Process Orders] ([~/?ScreenId=SO501000|SO501000]) or [HelpRoot_FormReference\SO_50_30_00|Process Shipments] ([~/?ScreenId=SO503000|SO503000]) form to consolidate multiple documents for the same customer into a single customer invoice. You can generate an invoice for a shipment only if it is confirmed (that is, if it has the ''Confirmed'' status). Also, you can create an invoice manually and add to it lines for multiple orders for the same customer. {br}
An invoice created on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SO_30_30_00|Invoices] ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) form in the Sales Orders module has one of the following statuses: [anchor|#ul_tdm_sh3_mdb] *''On Hold'': You can save an invoice with this status if you want to continue editing it. To save the invoice with the ''Balanced'' status, clear the '''Hold''' check box and save the document. If the '''Validate Totals''' check box has been selected on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SO_10_10_00|Sales Orders Preferences] ([~/?ScreenId=SO101000|SO101000]) form, you first need to type the control total into the '''Amount''' box. *''Balanced'': A ''Balanced'' invoice can be released to the Accounts Receivable module. When you release an invoice, the statuses of all shipments included in the invoice change to ''Invoiced''. *''Open'': When an invoice has been released to the Accounts Receivable module, it is assigned the ''Open'' status until it is paid by the customer. Also, upon release of the invoice, the status of the original sales order changes to ''Completed''. You can print the invoice (individually or among other invoices and memos) and send it to the customer by postal mail, or you can send the invoice as an email or email attachment, depending on the mailing settings of the customer account. For more information, see [HelpRoot_Financials\AR__con_Predefined_Mailings_for_Customers_and_Vendors|Mailings for Customers]. *''Closed'': Once it has been fully paid, the invoice gets the ''Closed'' status.
The release of an invoice generates transactions in the Inventory and Accounts Receivable modules and updates the General Ledger module. The reference to the batch that posts transactions to the General Ledger can be found on the '''Financial Details''' tab of the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SO_30_30_00|Invoices] form. Salespersons' commissions are calculated when the invoice is released or paid, depending on the commission settings on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\AR_10_10_00|Accounts Receivable Preferences] ([~/?ScreenId=AR101000|AR101000]) form. Total freight charges may include premium freight, insurance, shipment, and other charges that apply to the shipped goods and to entire shipments. The premium freight amounts, which are specified for sales orders, are allocated among the shipments fulfilling the order, based on the option selected in the '''Freight Allocation on Partial Shipping''' box on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SO_10_10_00|Sales Orders Preferences] ([~/?ScreenId=SO101000|SO101000]) form, which can be one of the following: [anchor|#ul_udm_sh3_mdb] *''Allocate Proportionally'': Distributes the premium freight amount shipments proportionally to the partial shipment amounts *''Full Amount First Time'': Assigns the premium freight amount to the first shipment
==Processing of Direct Invoices== If the ''Advanced SO Invoices'' feature is enabled on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\CS_10_00_00|Enable/Disable Features] ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) form, you can process invoices with stock items directly on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SO_30_30_00|Invoices] ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) without processing the corresponding sales orders and invoices. On release of direct invoices, the system updates the inventory. For more information, see [HelpRoot_OrderMgmt\SO__con_scn_Direct_Sale|Processing Direct Sales and Returns]. ==Credit Memo Processing== A credit memo is generated when a sales order of the ''Credit Memo'' type is fulfilled to adjust the customer’s balance with the company by the amount of the returned goods. Credit memos are used for unauthorized and authorized returns. A credit memo can be released to the Accounts Receivable module and can update the Inventory module. On the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SO_30_30_00|Invoices] ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) form, for a ''Balanced'' credit memo, the following actions become available on the '''Actions''' menu of the form toolbar: [anchor|#ul_vdm_sh3_mdb] *'''Release''': Releases the ''Balanced'' memo to the Accounts Receivable module, to credit the customer account for the returned goods. *'''Update IN''': Releases relevant data to the Inventory module. The stock levels are increased in the Inventory module by the quantity of the returned goods.
The original order will be assigned the ''Completed'' status once the related Accounts Receivable credit memo has been released. The reference number of the batch that posted the related transactions to the General Ledger module can be found on the '''Financial Details''' tab on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SO_30_30_00|Invoices] form. ==COGS Posting Delay== If there is a significant time interval between the release of issues and the release of invoices in your organization, you may need to delay posting the costs to the COGS accounts. To do this, select the '''Use Shipped-Not-Invoiced Account''' check box on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SO_10_10_00|Sales Orders Preferences] ([~/?ScreenId=SO101000|SO101000]) form, and then select the appropriate '''Shipped-Not-Invoiced Account''' and '''Shipped-Not-Invoiced Subaccount''' to be used to temporarily record the costs. After that, on release of issues, the costs of shipped items will be temporarily recorded to this shipped-not-invoiced account (with the specified subaccount); then later, on release of invoices, the costs will be moved from the shipped-not-invoiced account to the appropriate COGS /expense accounts.

For a sales order, you prepare a Sales Orders (SO) invoice, which can be reviewed on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices (SO303000) form. On release of the SO invoice, the system creates an Accounts Receivable (AR) invoice that is related to the SO invoice and has the same reference number. This AR invoice becomes available for reviewing and further processing on the ([~/?ScreenId=AR301000|AR301000]) Invoices and Memos (AR301000). An AR invoice is a financial document that doesn't have information about freight details. This information, along with links to shipments and sales orders, is provided in the SO invoice. The reference number assigned to the SO and AR invoices is printed in the customer statement so that these invoices appear to be a single document from the customer's perspective. The AR invoice is released on the release of the SO invoice (that is, the AR invoice is released as soon as it is created); the link to the created batch of the generated General Ledger transactions can be found in both of these documents. Invoice Processing You can prepare an invoice for a sales order that has been shipped or does not require shipping, or you can prepare an invoice for a shipment. Also, you can mass-prepare invoices from orders or shipments on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO501000|SO501000]) Process Orders (SO501000) or ([~/?ScreenId=SO503000|SO503000]) Process Shipments (SO503000) form to consolidate multiple documents for the same customer into a single customer invoice. You can generate an invoice for a shipment only if it is confirmed (that is, if it has the Confirmed status). Also, you can create an invoice manually and add to it lines for multiple orders for the same customer. An invoice created on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices (SO303000) form in the Sales Orders module has one of the following statuses: On Hold : You can save an invoice with this status if you want to continue editing it. To save the invoice with the Balanced status, clear the Hold check box and save the document. If the Validate Totals check box has been selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO101000|SO101000]) Sales Orders Preferences (SO101000) form, you first need to type the control total into the Amount box. Balanced : A Balanced invoice can be released to the Accounts Receivable module. When you release an invoice, the statuses of all shipments included in the invoice change to Invoiced . Open : When an invoice has been released to the Accounts Receivable module, it is assigned the Open status until it is paid by the customer. Also, upon release of the invoice, the status of the original sales order changes to Completed . You can print the invoice (individually or among other invoices and memos) and send it to the customer by postal mail, or you can send the invoice as an email or email attachment, depending on the mailing settings of the customer account. For more information, see Mailings for Customers. Closed : Once it has been fully paid, the invoice gets the Closed status. The release of an invoice generates transactions in the Inventory and Accounts Receivable modules and updates the General Ledger module. The reference to the batch that posts transactions to the General Ledger can be found on the Financial Details tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices form. Salespersons' commissions are calculated when the invoice is released or paid, depending on the commission settings on the ([~/?ScreenId=AR101000|AR101000]) Accounts Receivable Preferences (AR101000) form. Total freight charges may include premium freight, insurance, shipment, and other charges that apply to the shipped goods and to entire shipments. The premium freight amounts, which are specified for sales orders, are allocated among the shipments fulfilling the order, based on the option selected in the Freight Allocation on Partial Shipping box on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO101000|SO101000]) Sales Orders Preferences (SO101000) form, which can be one of the following: Allocate Proportionally : Distributes the premium freight amount shipments proportionally to the partial shipment amounts Full Amount First Time : Assigns the premium freight amount to the first shipment Processing of Direct Invoices If the Advanced SO Invoices feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form, you can process invoices with stock items directly on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices (SO303000) without processing the corresponding sales orders and invoices. On release of direct invoices, the system updates the inventory. For more information, see Processing Direct Sales and Returns. Credit Memo Processing A credit memo is generated when a sales order of the Credit Memo type is fulfilled to adjust the customer's balance with the company by the amount of the returned goods. Credit memos are used for unauthorized and authorized returns. A credit memo can be released to the Accounts Receivable module and can update the Inventory module. On the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices (SO303000) form, for a Balanced credit memo, the following actions become available on the Actions menu of the form toolbar: Release : Releases the Balanced memo to the Accounts Receivable module, to credit the customer account for the returned goods. Update IN : Releases relevant data to the Inventory module. The stock levels are increased in the Inventory module by the quantity of the returned goods. The original order will be assigned the Completed status once the related Accounts Receivable credit memo has been released. The reference number of the batch that posted the related transactions to the General Ledger module can be found on the Financial Details tab on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices form. COGS Posting Delay If there is a significant time interval between the release of issues and the release of invoices in your organization, you may need to delay posting the costs to the COGS accounts. To do this, select the Use Shipped-Not-Invoiced Account check box on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO101000|SO101000]) Sales Orders Preferences (SO101000) form, and then select the appropriate Shipped-Not-Invoiced Account and Shipped-Not-Invoiced Subaccount to be used to temporarily record the costs. After that, on release of issues, the costs of shipped items will be temporarily recorded to this shipped-not-invoiced account (with the specified subaccount); then later, on release of invoices, the costs will be moved from the shipped-not-invoiced account to the appropriate COGS /expense accounts.

To Prepare an Invoice for a Sales Order If you need to prepare an invoice for a particular sales order, you can do this from the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form. To open any form, you can navigate to it or search for it (by its name or by its form ID without periods). For more information about search capabilities, see Search in the Modern UI. To Prepare an Invoice for a Sales Order Open the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form by searching for or navigating to it. In the Order Type box of the Summary area, select the order type of the order for which you want to create an invoice. In the Order Nbr. box, select the reference number of the order for which you want to create an invoice. On the form toolbar, click Actions Prepare Invoice . Review the details of the prepared invoice on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices (SO303000) form, which opens. Notes About the Procedure The notes in this section describe the nuances of the UI elements available on the form, such as when an element is required and when it is not, and when the system fills in settings by default. This section can include other notes. Note the following about this procedure: By default, when a user prepares invoices, the system uses the dates of corresponding shipments as invoice date if the Use Shipment Date for Invoice Date check box is selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO101000|SO101000]) Sales Orders Preferences (SO101000) form. If you clear this check box, the system will prepare invoices with the current business date. The invoices are created with the Balanced status if the Hold Invoices on Entry check box is cleared in the settings of the order type on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO201000|SO201000]) Order Types (SO201000) form. Otherwise, if the check box is selected, the invoices are created with the On Hold status. You can mass-prepare invoices for orders by using the Prepare Invoice action on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO501000|SO501000]) Process Orders (SO501000) form, as described in the To Create Invoices for Multiple Orders topic.

row.PlainText: Sale with Transferred Stock Items Transfer orders are generated automatically from the transfer requests when the stock for sales order fulfillment is reserved in remote warehouses, or created manually to account for goods that are moved from one warehouse to another without a sale. Also, transfer orders can be generated in the process of replenishment, to move goods from the source warehouse to the warehouse where they are needed for sale. This part of the guide describes how to prepare transfer orders for sales order fulfillment, and how to apply landed costs to transfer orders in Acumatica ERP. . In This Part Processing Steps for a Sale with TransferVariations in the Transfer Order ProcessTo Create a Transfer Order (TR)To Create Transfer Orders for Multiple Sales OrdersTo Create Shipments for Multiple Orders

row.column: Processing Steps for a Sale with Transfer When you process a sale of inventory items, you can reserve one line or multiple lines of an open sales order of the SO or SA type in a warehouse other than the warehouse selected in the line. To be able to process a sales order with stock items that are reserved in a remote warehouse (that is, a warehouse other than the one specified in the order), you first need to transfer the reserved items from the remote source warehouse (at which the items were reserved) to the destination warehouse (for which the sales order is processed). For this purpose, a transfer order of the TR predefined order type is prepared and processed. For a description of other scenarios that may require preparing and processing transfer orders, see Variations in the Transfer Order Process, The processing of a sale with the transfer of items involves the actions and generated documents shown in the following diagram. 1. Enter the Sales Order You create a new sales order of the SO type on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form. If the order is created with the On Hold status, you should clear the Hold check box for the order to process it further. For more details on which information is to be specified in an order, see Sales Order Entry. 2. Reserve Items in the Source Warehouse To obtain the sufficient quantity of items for the sales order, you manually reserve the quantity for each specific item in the source warehouse. To be able to complete the sales order, you first need to perform a transfer of items allocated in a warehouse other than the destination warehouse. For the items allocated in a warehouse other than the warehouse specified in the sales order, the system automatically generates transfer requests of the SO Allocated plan type. Based on the transfer requests, you prepare transfer orders for these items. 3. Prepare the Transfer Order To create a transfer order (an order of the TR type) for a sales order, you click Actions > Create Transfer Order on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form. On the ([~/?ScreenId=SO509000|SO509000]) Create Transfer Orders (SO509000) form, which opens, you can create one transfer order or multiple transfer orders for transfer requests with the SO Allocated plan type. You can select the transfer requests by source and destination warehouses, item class, and product workgroup. After reviewing the resulting list, you can generate transfer orders for each line in the list, or you can select the orders to be generated by selecting the check boxes to the left of the plan types. 4. Prepare the Shipment A transfer order is fulfilled by one shipment or by multiple shipments from the source warehouse (in which the item is allocated) to the destination warehouse. You can create a shipment for a transfer order from the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form by clicking Actions Create Shipment on the form toolbar. If you need to create shipments for multiple transfer orders, you can run the Create Shipment process by using the ([~/?ScreenId=SO501000|SO501000]) Process Orders (SO501000) form. The shipments will be grouped by source and destination warehouses and by stock items. The item quantities on the shipment are deducted from the Available and Available for Shipping quantities and added to the SO Allocated quantity; you can see these quantities on the ([~/?ScreenId=IN402000|IN402000]) Inventory Allocation Details (IN402000) form, as well as on other forms. You can print a pick list for each shipment by clicking Actions Print Pick List on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO302000|SO302000]) Shipments (SO302000) form. Alternatively, you can print pick lists for multiple shipments by applying the Print Pick Lists action for the selected shipments on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO503000|SO503000]) Process Shipments (SO503000) form. 5. Confirm the Shipment You can confirm each shipment by using the ([~/?ScreenId=SO302000|SO302000]) Shipments (SO302000) form. Upon shipment confirmation, the quantities of items on the shipment are added to the SO Shipped quantity. 6. Update Inventory To promptly update the item quantities in the destination warehouse, you click Actions Update IN on the form toolbar; once you do, the system generates the inventory transfer document that issue items from the source warehouse. The item quantity is deducted from SO Shipped and added to In Transit. (These quantities are displayed on a variety of Inventory inquiries and reports.) 7. Release the Inventory Transfer To release the inventory transfer, you click Release on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=IN304000|IN304000]) Transfers (IN304000) form. On release of the inventory transfer, a batch of General Ledger transactions is generated that moves the cost of transferred items to the In-Transit account. 8. Prepare the Transfer Receipt To complete the two-step inventory transfer, you should prepare the transfer receipt (that is, a receipt of the Transfer Receipt type) of items to the destination warehouse. You create a transfer receipt on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO302000|PO302000]) Purchase Receipts (PO302000) form and add to the receipt the lines from one transfer order or multiple transfer orders. A transfer receipt may include only some of the lines from a transfer order; you can also change the quantity in a particular line if the items specified in this line were received partially. 9. Release the Transfer Receipt You release the transfer receipt by clicking Release on the table toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=PO302000|PO302000]) Purchase Receipts (PO302000) form. On release of the transfer receipt, the inventory receipt document is generated to receive the items to the destination warehouse. 10. Release the Inventory Receipt You release the inventory receipt by clicking Release on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=IN301000|IN301000]) Receipts (IN301000) form. On release of the inventory transfer, a batch of General Ledger transactions is generated that moves the cost of transferred items from the In-Transit account. Thus, the quantity of the item that has been transferred from the source warehouse to the destination warehouse becomes available for sale. The item quantity is deducted from the In-Transit quantity and added to Quantity Available and Quantity on Hand. After the transferred stock item or items have been received to the destination warehouse, you can complete the sales order in the same way as if you have just entered it. (For the general steps of sales order processing, see Sale of Stock Items with Shipping.)

Variations in the Transfer Order Process Transfer orders can be created manually to account for goods that are moved from one warehouse to another, or generated automatically when the stock for sales order fulfillment is reserved in a warehouse (or multiple warehouses) other than the one specified in the sales order. Also, transfer orders can be generated in the process of replenishment, to move goods from the source warehouse to the warehouse where they are needed for sale. For a detailed description of a general workflow of a sale with items that are reserved in a remote warehouse, see Processing Steps for a Sale with Transfer. In addition to the general workflow, the following scenarios are available for transfer orders: You can use transfer orders for transferring items between warehouses without a sale being associated with the transfer. For this purpose, you can create an individual transfer order of the TR type by entering all the required information on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form. The general process is the same as described in the Processing Steps for a Sale with Transfer topic, starting from Step 3. If needed, you can reserve stock in the source warehouse for each line item on the transfer order by selecting the line and clicking the Allocations button on the table toolbar, and then creating additional allocation schedules. You can create transfer orders for replenishment requests by transfer on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO509000|SO509000]) Create Transfer Orders (SO509000) form. For more information about inventory replenishment, see Replenishing Inventory Items.

If you need to record the movement of goods from one warehouse to another, you create a transfer order (that is, a sales order of the predefined ''TR'' type) by using the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SO_30_10_00|Sales Orders] ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) form.[anchor|#_ae8d7842-e765-4c71-b53e-c64522161fb5]((({S:Hint}To open any form, you can navigate to it or search for it (by its name or by its form ID without periods). For more information about search capabilities, see [HelpRoot_Interface\UIG__con_New_UI_Search|Search in the Modern UI]. ))) ==To Create a Transfer Order==[anchor|#ol_vng_clz_lz] #Open the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SO_30_10_00|Sales Orders] ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) form by searching for or navigating to it. #In the '''Order Type''' box in the Summary area, select ''TR''. #In the '''Destination Warehouse''' box, select the warehouse to be replenished. #In the '''Date''' box, change the date of the transfer if you need a date other than the current business date. #If this transfer order is associated with a particular project, in the '''Project''' box, change the ''X '' non-project code (which appears by default) to the particular project. #In the '''Description''' box, enter a brief description for this transfer. #On the '''Document Details''' tab, perform the following steps to add one item or multiple items to the transfer order: ##Click '''Add Stock Item''' on the table toolbar. The '''Inventory Lookup''' dialog box appears with a list of active inventory items. You can use the selection criteria at the top of the dialog box to narrow the list of items. ##In the line or lines with the items that you want to add, in the '''Qty. Selected''' column, specify the requested quantity of the items (measured in the default unit of measure shown in the '''UOM''' column). Notice the item availability data in the columns to the right. ##Click '''Add & Close''' to add the items and close the dialog box. #If needed, allocate the quantities of specific items for this transfer in the source warehouse. #If needed, specify lot or serial numbers for specific items for this transfer. #Clear the '''Hold''' check box in the Summary area. #Click '''Save''' on the form toolbar.

To Create a Transfer Order (TR) If you need to record the movement of goods from one warehouse to another, you create a transfer order (that is, a sales order of the predefined TR type) by using the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form. To open any form, you can navigate to it or search for it (by its name or by its form ID without periods). For more information about search capabilities, see Search in the Modern UI. To Create a Transfer Order Open the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form by searching for or navigating to it. In the Order Type box in the Summary area, select TR . In the Destination Warehouse box, select the warehouse to be replenished. In the Date box, change the date of the transfer if you need a date other than the current business date. If this transfer order is associated with a particular project, in the Project box, change the X non-project code (which appears by default) to the particular project. In the Description box, enter a brief description for this transfer. On the Document Details tab, perform the following steps to add one item or multiple items to the transfer order: Click Add Stock Item on the table toolbar. The Inventory Lookup dialog box appears with a list of active inventory items. You can use the selection criteria at the top of the dialog box to narrow the list of items. In the line or lines with the items that you want to add, in the Qty. Selected column, specify the requested quantity of the items (measured in the default unit of measure shown in the UOM column). Notice the item availability data in the columns to the right. Click Add & Close to add the items and close the dialog box. If needed, allocate the quantities of specific items for this transfer in the source warehouse. If needed, specify lot or serial numbers for specific items for this transfer. Clear the Hold check box in the Summary area. Click Save on the form toolbar. Notes About the Procedure The notes in this section describe the nuances of the UI elements available on the form, such as when an element is required and when it is not, and when the system fills in settings by default. This section can include other notes. Note the following about this procedure: Transfer orders are available only if the Multiple Warehouses feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form. If TR is not available for selection in the Order Type box, enable the TR order type on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO201000|SO201000]) Order Types (SO201000) form. The functionality of stock allocation (reservation) is available only if any of the following features are enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features form: Multiple Warehouses , Sales Order to Purchase Order Link , or Lot and Serial Tracking . You can specify lot and serial numbers for items only if the Lot and Serial Tracking feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features form. To limit the range of items in the Inventory Lookup dialog box, you can do any of the following: Type a string in the Inventory box to find the item by this string in its inventory ID, description, or alternate ID type. Click the Sold Since option button if the item has been sold recently. When you do, the Sold Since box appears with a date that is three months earlier than the current business date; select another date if needed. The list of items is populated with the items that have been sold in this date range. Select the Show Available Items Only check box to review only items whose available quantities are greater than 0. Clear this check box to see all items. If subitems are used in your system, to narrow the resulting list to a particular subitem of the item, select the needed subitem in the Subitem box. To narrow the list to items located in a particular warehouse, select the warehouse in the Warehouse box.

To Create Transfer Orders for Multiple Sales Orders If you need to record the movement of goods from one warehouse to another, you create a transfer order of the predefined TR type. You can mass-create transfer orders for multiple sales orders simultaneously on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO509000|SO509000]) Create Transfer Orders (SO509000) form. To Create Transfer Orders for Multiple Orders Open the ([~/?ScreenId=SO509000|SO509000]) Create Transfer Orders (SO509000) form by searching for or navigating to it. To open any form, you can navigate to it or search for it (by its name or by its form ID without periods). For more information about search capabilities, see Search in the Modern UI. In the Creation Date box, select the date on which the transfer order or orders should be prepared. In the table, select the unlabeled check boxes next to the needed line or lines with the SO Allocated plan type. Click Process on the form toolbar, or click Process All to process all lines shown in the table. To Create a Transfer Receipt for Transfer Order If you need to create transfer receipt for a for a particular transfer order, you can do this from the ([~/?ScreenId=PO302000|PO302000]) Purchase Receipts (PO302000) form, as described in the instructions below. To Create a Transfer Receipt for Transfer Order Open the ([~/?ScreenId=PO302000|PO302000]) Purchase Receipts (PO302000) form by searching for or navigating to it. To open any form, you can navigate to it or search for it (by its name or by its form ID without periods). For more information about search capabilities, see Search in the Modern UI. An invoice order, which has the ''IN'' order type selected on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SO_30_10_00|Sales Orders] ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) form, is a special type of sales order that you create when the goods requested by a customer have been shipped or delivered already, and thus the order does not require a shipment to be processed. The processing of an invoice order involves the actions and generated documents shown in the following diagram. ((({S:Hint}If quick processing is configured for the ''IN'' order type, you can perform complete processing of the order directly from the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SO_30_10_00|Sales Orders] form. For more information, see [HelpRoot_OrderMgmt\SO__con_Quick_Process_Workflow|Quick Processing of Sales Orders]. )))[anchor|#fig_dc5_dmr_gdb][anchor|#image_ec5_dmr_gdb][image:UserGuide/Images/Inventory_Sale_Without_Shipment.png|popup|300px] The following sections describe in detail the processing steps shown in the diagram.{br}{TOC} ==1. Enter the Sales Order== A new sales order of the ''IN'' type is created on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SO_30_10_00|Sales Orders] ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) form. The reference numbers for a new order is generated according to the numbering sequence assigned to this order type on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SO_20_10_00|Order Types] ([~/?ScreenId=SO201000|SO201000])form. If the order is created with the ''On Hold'' status, you should clear the '''Hold''' check box for the order to process it further.((({S:Hint}For items that have lot or serial numbers tracked in Acumatica ERP, you can specify these numbers in the document lines, thus indicating that these particular items have been delivered to the customer. ))) ==2. Prepare the Sales Orders Invoice== You can prepare a Sales Orders (SO) invoice for an order by clicking '''Actions''' > '''Prepare Invoice''' on the form toolbar of the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SO_30_10_00|Sales Orders] ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) form, or you can create multiple invoices by specifying the ''Prepare Invoice'' action on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SO_50_10_00|Process Orders] ([~/?ScreenId=SO501000|SO501000]) form and processing multiple selected orders.{br}
Any prepared SO invoice can be reviewed on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SO_30_30_00|Invoices] ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) form. You can print an SO invoice by clicking '''Reports > Print Invoice''' on the form toolbar of the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SO_30_30_00|Invoices] form. ==3. Release the Sales Orders Invoice== To release the Sales Orders invoice, you click '''Actions > Release''' on the form toolbar of the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SO_30_30_00|Invoices] ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) form. When the SO invoice is released, the batch of General Ledger transactions is generated. Also, when the SO invoice is released, the system automatically generates a corresponding inventory issue with the date and posting period of the invoice. The related Accounts Receivable invoice with the same reference number becomes available for reviewing on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\AR_30_10_00|Invoices and Memos] ([~/?ScreenId=AR301000|AR301000]) form. For more information on processing Accounts Receivable invoices, see [HelpRoot_Financials\AR__MNG_InvoicesMemos|Processing Invoices]. ==4. Release the Inventory Issue== The generated inventory issue is released automatically if the '''Automatically Release IN Documents''' check box is selected on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SO_10_10_00|Sales Orders Preferences] ([~/?ScreenId=SO101000|SO101000]) form. If this check box is cleared, you have to release the inventory issue manually by clicking '''Release''' on the form toolbar of the [HelpRoot_FormReference\IN_30_20_00|Issues] ([~/?ScreenId=IN302000|IN302000]) form. On release of the inventory issue, the batch of General Ledger transactions is generated. ==Related Articles== *[HelpRoot_OrderMgmt\SO__CNF_OrderType_IN|IN Order Type (Invoice)]

Sale of Stock Items Without Shipment An invoice order, which has the IN order type selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form, is a special type of sales order that you create when the goods requested by a customer have been shipped or delivered already, and thus the order does not require a shipment to be processed. The processing of an invoice order involves the actions and generated documents shown in the following diagram. If quick processing is configured for the IN order type, you can perform complete processing of the order directly from the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders form. For more information, see Quick Processing of Sales Orders. The following sections describe in detail the processing steps shown in the diagram. 1. Enter the Sales Order A new sales order of the IN type is created on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form. For items that have lot or serial numbers tracked in Acumatica ERP, you can specify these numbers in the document lines, thus indicating that these particular items have been delivered to the customer. 2. You can print an SO invoice by clicking Reports > Print Invoice on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices form. 3. Release the Sales Orders Invoice To release the Sales Orders invoice, you click Actions > Release on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices (SO303000) form. When the SO invoice is released, the batch of General Ledger transactions is generated. Also, when the SO invoice is released, the system automatically generates a corresponding inventory issue with the date and posting period of the invoice. The related Accounts Receivable invoice with the same reference number becomes available for reviewing on the ([~/?ScreenId=AR301000|AR301000]) Invoices and Memos (AR301000) form. For more information on processing Accounts Receivable invoices, see Processing Invoices. 4. Release the Inventory Issue The generated inventory issue is released automatically if the Automatically Release IN Documents check box is selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO101000|SO101000]) Sales Orders Preferences (SO101000) form. If this check box is cleared, you have to release the inventory issue manually by clicking Release on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=IN302000|IN302000]) Issues (IN302000) form. On release of the inventory issue, the batch of General Ledger transactions is generated.

To Enter an Invoice Order (IN) You create an order of the predefined IN type to record a sale of stock items that have been already shipped to customer (or customer picks them at the sale point). You create an IN order on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form. To Enter an Invoice Order Open the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form by searching for or navigating to it. To open any form, you can navigate to it or search for it (by its name or by its form ID without periods). For more information about search capabilities, see Search in the Modern UI. In the Order Type box in the Summary area, select IN (Invoice) . Select the customer in the Customer box. Optional: In the Location box, check the default location of the customer, and change it if needed for the order. Optional: Check the currency and the currency exchange rate; change these in the Currency box, if needed. If this invoice order is associated with a particular project, in the Project box, change the X non-project code (which is shown by default) to the particular project. In the Date and Requested On boxes, change the dates of the order (which by default is the current business date) if needed. Optional: In the Customer Order box, enter the reference number of the original customer document the invoice order is based on. Optional: In the Description box, provide a brief description for this invoice order. On the Document Details tab, perform the following steps to add one item or multiple items to the invoice order: Click Add Stock Item on the table toolbar. The Inventory Lookup dialog box appears with the list of active stock items. You can use the selection criteria at the top of the dialog box to narrow the list of items. In the line or lines with the items that you want to add, in the Qty. Selected column, specify the requested quantity of the items (measured in the default unit of measure shown in the UOM column). Notice the item availability data in the Qty. Available and Qty. On Hand column, and make sure that the specified quantity is available in the selected warehouse for each item to be added to the invoice order. Click Add & Close at the bottom of the dialog box. If needed, specify lot or serial numbers for specific items in this invoice order. Clear the Hold check box in the Summary area, if it is selected. Click Save on the form toolbar to save the created invoice order.

This generates a Sales Orders invoice. To Process an Invoice Order To record a sale of stock items that have been already shipped to customer, you process an invoice order (that is, an order of the IN order type) by using the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form. To Process an Invoice Order Open the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form by searching for or navigating to it. To open any form, you can navigate to it or search for it (by its name or by its form ID without periods). For more information about search capabilities, see Search in the Modern UI. Select the order by specifying its type ( IN ) and its reference number. On the form toolbar, click Actions Prepare Invoice . This generates a Sales Orders invoice. The system opens the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices (SO303000) form to display the new document. On the form toolbar of the opened form, click Actions Release to release the Sales Orders invoice. The system generates an inventory transaction of the Invoice type to issue the items from inventory. Once you release the Sales Orders invoice, the original IN order gets the Completed status.

Sale of Stock Items by Cash To process a sale of items directly to the customer and when you are receiving payment at that time (by cash, check, or credit card), you can create a cash sale order of the CS order type by using the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form. The processing of cash sales orders involves the actions and generated documents shown in the following diagram. If quick processing is configured for the CS order type, you can perform complete processing of the order directly from the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form. For more information, see Quick Processing of Sales Orders. The following sections describe in detail the processing steps shown in the diagram. 1. Enter the Sales Order A new sales order of the CS type is created on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form. You can save the order of the CS type only after you specify the payment information, including the payment method, cash account, and payment reference number (and the card information if the payment is performed with a credit card). The reference number for a new order is generated according to the numbering sequence assigned to this order type on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO201000|SO201000]) Order Types (SO201000) form. If the order is created with the On Hold status, you should clear the Hold check box for the order to process it further. 2. Prepare the Sales Orders Invoice You can prepare the Sales Orders (SO) invoice by clicking Actions Prepare Invoice on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form, or you can create invoices by specifying the Prepare Invoice action on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO501000|SO501000]) Process Orders (SO501000) form and processing multiple selected orders. For the cash sale order, an SO invoice of the Cash Sale type is prepared. Any prepared SO invoice can be reviewed on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices (SO303000) form. You can print an SO invoice by clicking Reports > Print Invoice on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices form. 3. Release the Sales Orders Invoice To release the Sales Orders invoice, you click Actions > Release on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices form. When the SO invoice of the Cash Sale type is released, a batch of General Ledger transactions is generated. Also, when the SO invoice is released, the system automatically generates a corresponding inventory issue with the date and posting period of the SO invoice. The related Accounts Receivable cash sale with the same reference number becomes available for reviewing on the ([~/?ScreenId=AR304000|AR304000]) Cash Sales (AR304000) form. For more information on processing Accounts Receivable cash sales, see Processing AR Documents. 4. Release the Inventory Issue The generated inventory issue is released automatically if the Automatically Release IN Documents check box is selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO101000|SO101000]) Sales Orders Preferences (SO101000) form. If this check box is cleared, you have to release the inventory issue manually by clicking Release on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=IN302000|IN302000]) Issues (IN302000) form. On release of the inventory issue, a batch of General Ledger transactions is generated. Important Notes Note the following about the processing of cash sales orders: If you process a cash sales order with only non-stock items, no inventory issue is generated when the SO invoice of the Cash Sale type is released. For non-stock items and services, you can enter a process a cash sale directly on the ([~/?ScreenId=AR304000|AR304000]) Cash Sales (AR304000) form without creating and processing a cash sale order. For items that have lot or serial numbers tracked in Acumatica ERP, you can specify these numbers, thus indicating that these particular items have been delivered to the customer.
