To Enter a Cash Sale Order (CS) You create an order of the predefined CS type to record a sale of stock items that is immediately paid by cash or credit card and does not require shipping. You use the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form to enter the CS order. To Create a Cash Sale Order Open the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form by searching for or navigating to it. To open any form, you can navigate to it or search for it (by its name or by its form ID without periods). For more information about search capabilities, see Search in the Modern UI. In the Order Type box in the Summary area, select CS (Cash Sale) . Select the customer in the Customer box. Optional: In the Location box, check the default location of the customer, and change it if needed for the order. Optional: Check the currency and the currency exchange rate; change these in the Currency box, if needed. If this cash sale order is associated with a particular project, in the Project box, change the X non-project code (which is shown by default) to the particular project. In the Date and Requested On boxes, change the dates of the order (which by default is the current business date) if needed. Optional: In the Customer Order box, enter the reference number of the original customer document the case sale order is based on. Optional: In the Description box, provide a brief description for this cash sale order. On the Payment Settings tab specify the following information: In the Payment Method box, check the customer's default payment method. The cash sale must be paid by a method based on cash, check, or credit card. In the Cash Account box, check the default cash account of the selected payment method. Change it, if needed. In the Payment Ref. box, enter the reference number of the customer payment. On the Document Details tab, perform the following steps to add one item or multiple items to the cash sale order: Click Add Stock Item on the table toolbar. The Inventory Lookup dialog box appears with the list of active stock items. You can use the selection criteria at the top of the dialog box to narrow the list of items. In the line or lines with the items that you want to add, in the Qty. Selected column, specify the requested quantity of the items (measured in the default unit of measure shown in the UOM column). Notice the item availability data in the Qty. Available and Qty. On Hand column, and make sure that the specified quantity is available in the selected warehouse for each item to be added to the cash sale. Click Add & Close at the bottom of the dialog box. If needed, specify lot or serial numbers for specific items in this cash sale order. Clear the Hold check box in the Summary area, if it is selected. Click Save on the form toolbar to save the created cash sale order.

For more information about search capabilities, see [HelpRoot_Interface\UIG__con_New_UI_Search|Search in the Modern UI]. ))) #Select the order by specifying its type (''CS'') and its reference number. #On the form toolbar, click '''Actions''' > '''Prepare Invoice'''. The system generates an inventory transaction of the ''Credit Memo'' type to issue the items from inventory. Once you release the cash sale, the original ''CS'' order gets the ''Completed'' status.

To Process a Cash Sale Order (CS) You process an order of the predefined CS type to record a sale of stock items that is immediately paid by cash or credit card and does not require shipping. You process a CS order on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form. To Process a Cash Sale Open the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form by searching for or navigating to it. To open any form, you can navigate to it or search for it (by its name or by its form ID without periods). For more information about search capabilities, see Search in the Modern UI. Select the order by specifying its type ( CS ) and its reference number. On the form toolbar, click Actions Prepare Invoice . This generates an SO invoice with a Cash Sale type. The system opens the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices (SO303000) form to display the new document. On the form toolbar of the opened form, click Actions Release to release the SO cash sale. The system generates an inventory transaction of the Credit Memo type to issue the items from inventory. Once you release the cash sale, the original CS order gets the Completed status.

row.PlainText: Processing Sales of Non-Stock Items Non-stock items in Acumatica ERP are used for representing the products that cannot be stocked in warehouses (such as services or charges) or the physical entities whose quantities you do not need to track. Sales of non-stock items can be processed either through an accounts receivable invoice from the ([~/?ScreenId=AR301000|AR301000]) Invoices and Memos (AR301000) form or through a sales order from the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form. Depending on the business requirements of the company, you may want to streamline sales processing and enter all sales, including the sale of non-stock items, through sales orders. The topics of this chapter describe the sales processes that can be performed for non-stock items. In This Chapter Sale of ServicesSale of Non-Stock Items with Shipping

row.column: Sale of Services In Acumatica ERP, services are represented by non-stock items that have the Require Shipment check box cleared in the item's settings on the ([~/?ScreenId=IN202000|IN202000]) Non-Stock Items (IN202000) form. If a sales order includes only services that do not require shipment, the typical processing of the sales order involves the steps and generated documents shown in the following diagram. The following sections describe in detail the processing steps shown in the diagram. 1. Enter the Sales Order You create the sales order of the SO or IN type on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form. Reference numbers for new orders are generated according to the numbering sequence assigned to this order type on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO201000|SO201000]) Order Types (SO201000) form. For the sales order, on the Document Details tab, you add lines with items to be sold. Non-stock items are considered to be always available and cannot be allocated. If the order has been created with the On Hold status, you should clear the On Hold check box for the order to process it further. On the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders form, you can print a sales order by clicking Reports > Print Sales Order/Quote on the form toolbar. 2. Prepare the Sales Orders Invoice You can prepare a Sales Orders invoice for a particular order you are viewing on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form by clicking Actions Prepare Invoice on the form toolbar. Alternatively, you can create multiple invoices by selecting the Prepare Invoice action and processing multiple orders (either all orders or only those you select) on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO501000|SO501000]) Process Orders (SO501000) form. Any prepared Sales Orders invoice can be reviewed on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices (SO303000) form. You can print the Sales Orders invoice on this form by clicking Reports > Print Invoice on the form toolbar. 3. Release the Sales Orders Invoice To release the Sales Orders invoice, you click Actions > Release on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices (SO303000) form. When the Sales Orders invoice is released, a batch of General Ledger transactions is generated. Also, when this invoice is released, the related Accounts Receivable invoice with the same reference number becomes available on the ([~/?ScreenId=AR301000|AR301000]) Invoices and Memos (AR301000) form. For more information on the further processing of Accounts Receivable invoices, see Processing Invoices. No inventory issue is generated because non-stock items are not tracked in inventory. If you have prepared a sales order with mixed lines of items (stock or non-stock, or both) that require shipping and non-stock items that do not require shipping, the shipment prepared for the order includes only the items that require shipping, while the prepared Sales Orders invoice for the sales order lists all the items from the order. The inventory issue generated on release of the Sales Orders invoice includes only stock items because their quantities are tracked in inventory.

Sale of Non-Stock Items with Shipping Although non-stock items are not tracked in inventory, you may want to process them through shipment, so that these items will be listed in pick lists and shipment confirmations, if the customer has requested the listing of these items in these documents. If a non-stock item has the Require Shipment check box selected in the item's settings on the ([~/?ScreenId=IN202000|IN202000]) Non-Stock Items (IN202000) form, the item is processed through shipments. If a sales order includes only non-stock items requiring shipment, the processing of the sales order involves the steps and generated documents shown in the following diagram. The following sections describe in detail the processing steps shown in the diagram. 1. Enter the Sales Order You create a new sales order of the SO type on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form. Reference numbers for new orders are generated in accordance with the numbering sequence assigned to this order type on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO201000|SO201000]) Order Types (SO201000) form. On the Document Details tab, you add lines with the items to be sold. Non-stock items are considered to be always available; thus, they cannot be allocated. New orders of the SO type are saved with the On Hold status by default if the Hold Documents on Entry check box is selected for this order type on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO201000|SO201000]) Order Types form. You should clear the Hold check box on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders form for the order to process the order further. On this form, you can print a sales order by clicking Reports > Print Sales Order/Quote on the form toolbar. 2. Prepare the Shipment You can create a shipment for an individual sales order you are viewing on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form by clicking Actions Create Shipment on the form toolbar. Alternatively, you can create shipments for multiple orders on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO501000|SO501000]) Process Orders (SO501000) form by selecting the Create Shipment action and processing multiple orders (either all orders or only those you select). The newly created shipments will have the Open status if the Hold Shipments on Entry check box is cleared on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO101000|SO101000]) Sales Orders Preferences (SO101000) form and the On Hold status if this check box is selected. Any prepared shipment can be reviewed on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO302000|SO302000]) Shipments (SO302000) form. On this form, you can print a pick list for a particular shipment. For multiple shipments with the On Hold and Open statuses, you can print pick lists by using the ([~/?ScreenId=SO503000|SO503000]) Process Shipments (SO503000) form. For more details, see Shipment Processing Steps. 3. Confirm the Shipment You can confirm a shipment that you are viewing on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO302000|SO302000]) Shipments (SO302000) form by clicking Actions Confirm Shipment on the form toolbar. Alternatively, you can confirm multiple shipments on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO503000|SO503000]) Process Shipments (SO503000) form by selecting the Confirm Shipment action and processing multiple shipments (either all shipments or only those you select). You can print a shipment confirmation for a particular shipment you are viewing on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO302000|SO302000]) Shipments form by clicking Reports > Print Shipment Confirmation on the form toolbar. For multiple shipments, you can print shipment confirmations by using the ([~/?ScreenId=SO503000|SO503000]) Process Shipments form. For more details, see Shipment Processing Steps. 4. Prepare the Sales Orders Invoice You can prepare a Sales Orders invoice for a particular shipment you are viewing on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO302000|SO302000]) Shipments (SO302000) form by clicking Actions Prepare Invoice on the form toolbar. Alternatively, you can create multiple invoices on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO503000|SO503000]) Process Shipments (SO503000) form by selecting the Prepare Invoice action and processing multiple shipments (either all shipments or only those you select). Any of the prepared Sales Orders invoices can be reviewed on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices (SO303000) form. You can print a Sales Orders invoice by clicking Reports > Print Invoice on the form toolbar of this form. 5. Release the Sales Orders Invoice To release the Sales Orders invoice, you click Actions > Release on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices (SO303000) form. When the Sales Orders invoice is released, a batch of General Ledger transactions is generated. Also, when this invoice is released, the related Accounts Receivable invoice with the same reference number becomes available on the ([~/?ScreenId=AR301000|AR301000]) Invoices and Memos (AR301000) form. For more information on the further processing of Accounts Receivable invoices, see Processing Invoices. No inventory issue is generated on release of the Sales Orders invoice with non-stock items because these items are not tracked in inventory. If you have prepared a sales order with mixed lines of items (stock or non-stock, or both) that require shipping and non-stock items that do not require shipping, the shipment prepared for the order includes only the items that require shipping, while the prepared Sales Orders invoice for the sales order lists all the items from it. The inventory issue generated on release of the sales order invoice includes only stock items because their quantities are tracked in inventory.

Processing Sales for Drop-Shipment In Acumatica ERP, if the Drop Shipments feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form, you can create sales orders whose goods are intended for drop-shipping. Drop-shipping means that a customer orders the goods from your company, sends the payment for the order to your company, and receives the goods directly from one of your vendors. For a sales order that includes items intended for drop-shipping, the typical processing involves the actions and generated documents shown in the following diagram. The following sections describe in detail the processing steps shown in the diagram. 1. Enter the Sales Order For a sales order in which some or all items will be drop-shipped, you create a new sales order of the SO type on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form. Its reference number is generated according to the numbering sequence assigned to this order type on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO201000|SO201000]) Order Types (SO201000) form, and the order is saved with the On Hold status by default if the Hold Documents on Entry check box is selected for this order type on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO201000|SO201000]) Order Types form. If the order is on hold, you should clear the Hold check box on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders form for the order so you can process it further. 2. Mark the Line or Lines for Drop-Shipping For each line of the sales order that is intended for drop-shipping, on the Document Details tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders form, you need to select the check box in the Mark for PO column and select Drop-Ship in the PO Source column. The system does not allocate stock items in inventory based on the quantities of goods and the document amounts on sales orders for drop-shipping. When you save a sales order with the Open status, for each sales order line that is marked for drop-shipping, a purchase request of the Drop-Ship type is generated in the system. You can review the purchase requests on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO505000|PO505000]) Create Purchase Orders (PO505000) form and generate drop-ship purchase orders based on these purchase requests. 3. Create the Drop-Ship Purchase Order Drop-ship purchase orders can be mass-generated for multiple sales orders or can be created one by one for each sales order. For the latter option, while viewing a sales order with lines for drop-shipping on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form, you click Actions > Create Purchase Order ; this opens the ([~/?ScreenId=PO505000|PO505000]) Create Purchase Orders form, on which you can create drop-ship purchase orders based on the drop-ship purchase requests that have been created for this sales order. On this form, you select the unlabeled check box next to the lines to be processed (which could include lines from the sales order you were working with or any other order), and click Process on the form toolbar to generate the purchase order or orders of the Drop-Ship type. As an alternative to the actions in the previous paragraph, you can create a purchase order of the Drop-Ship type manually on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders (PO301000) form, and then return to the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders form and link each applicable sales order line to this drop-ship purchase order manually. To do this, on the Document Details tab, you click the needed sales order line, and click PO Link on the table toolbar. In the Purchasing Details dialog box, which the system opens, select the line of the drop-ship purchase order to which the sales order line has to be linked. On the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders form, you can print a purchase order you have created by clicking Reports > Print Purchase Order on the form toolbar. 4. Create the Purchase Receipt for the Drop-Ship Purchase Order After you have received a confirmation that the customer has received the goods from the vendor, you prepare a purchase receipt for the drop-ship purchase order. For each separate drop-ship purchase order, while viewing the order on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders (PO301000) form, you can click Actions > Enter PO Receipt on the form toolbar to create the purchase receipt manually. Alternatively, you can create a receipt by using the ([~/?ScreenId=PO302000|PO302000]) Purchase Receipts (PO302000) form, and add to it multiple purchase orders of the same vendor by clicking Add PO or Add PO Line on the table toolbar of the Document Details tab. You then add the needed purchase orders or separate purchase order lines in the dialog that opens. 5. Release the Purchase Receipt To release the purchase receipt, you click Release on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=PO302000|PO302000]) Purchase Receipts (PO302000) form. The system does not create an inventory receipt on release of the purchase receipt because the items are not received in inventory and are instead delivered directly to the customer. When you release the purchase receipt, the status of the drop-ship purchase order is changed to Closed ; the sales order becomes completed, because for drop-ship lines of sales orders, purchase receipts function as shipments do. 6. Prepare the Accounts Payable Bill If the Create Bill check box is selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO302000|PO302000]) Purchase Receipts (PO302000) form, when you released the purchase receipt, the system generated an Accounts Payable bill to the vendor of the drop-shipped stock items automatically. Otherwise, you need to prepare the bill manually: While you are viewing the applicable purchase receipt on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO302000|PO302000]) Purchase Receipts form, you can click Actions > Enter AP Bill on the form toolbar. 7. Release the Accounts Payable Bill To release the Accounts Payable bill, you click Release on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=AP301000|AP301000]) Bills and Adjustments (AP301000) form. On release of the bill, a batch of General Ledger Transactions is generated. 8. Create a Sales Orders Invoice You can prepare a Sales Orders (SO) invoice to be sent to a customer by clicking Actions Prepare Invoice on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders form while viewing the applicable sales order. Alternatively, you can create multiple invoices on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO501000|SO501000]) Process Orders (SO501000) form by specifying the Prepare Invoice action and processing multiple orders (all listed orders or only those you select). Any prepared SO invoice can be reviewed on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices (SO303000) form. You can print an SO invoice by clicking Reports > Print Invoice on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices form. 9. Release the Sales Orders Invoice To release the Sales Orders invoice, you click Actions > Release on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices form. On release of the invoice, a batch of General Ledger transactions is generated, and the system automatically generates a corresponding inventory issue with the date and posting period of the invoice. Also, when the SO invoice is released, the related Accounts Receivable invoice with the same reference number is generated and can be viewed on the ([~/?ScreenId=AR301000|AR301000]) Invoices and Memos (AR301000) form. For more information on processing Accounts Receivable invoices, see Processing Invoices. 10. Release the Inventory Issue The generated inventory issue is released automatically if the Automatically Release IN Documents check box is selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO101000|SO101000]) Sales Orders Preferences (SO101000) form. If this check box is cleared, you have to release the inventory issue manually by clicking Release on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=IN302000|IN302000]) Issues (IN302000) form. On release of the inventory issue, a batch of General Ledger transactions is generated.

Drop-Ship Purchase Orders Drop shipping is a type of sales order fulfillment in which the customers order goods from your company, receive them directly from a vendor (wholesaler or manufacturer), and send payments for the orders to your company. The quantities of stock items on completed drop-ship orders are not included in the quantities available at any warehouse of your company, and no data in the Inventory module is updated when the drop-ship orders are completed. With Acumatica ERP, you can create drop-ship orders for goods that should be delivered directly to a customer location. You can add the following types of items to drop-ship orders: Stock items: The system automatically assigns the Goods for Drop-Ship line type to these items. Non-stock items that have both the Require Receipt and Require Shipment check boxes selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=IN202000|IN202000]) Non-Stock Items (IN202000) form: The system automatically assigns the Non-Stock for Drop-Ship line type to these items. Non-stock items that have the Require Receipt check box selected and the Require Shipment check box cleared on the ([~/?ScreenId=IN202000|IN202000]) Non-Stock Items (IN202000) form: The system automatically assigns the Non-Stock line type to these items. The Non-Stock lines do not need to be linked to a sales order document. Kits cannot be drop-shipped, because they are manufactured in your company. You can create drop-ship orders based on sales orders and on requisitions created for customers. Enabling Drop-Ship Orders In Acumatica ERP, the functionality of drop-ship orders is available only if the Inventory and Drop Shipments features are enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form. If the Multiple Warehouses and Multiple Warehouse Locations features are enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form, before you start creating and processing drop-ship orders, make sure that the Drop Shipments feature is enabled and that each warehouse has a default location for drop-ship orders selected in the Drop-Ship Location box on the Location Table tab on the ([~/?ScreenId=IN204000|IN204000]) Warehouses (IN204000) form. Because specifying a warehouse and warehouse location is mandatory for all inventory documents, the system will automatically insert this location in all documents generated for drop-ship orders. Processing Different Line Types in Drop-Ship Orders Drop-ship orders can include lines of different types. The type a particular line has depends on the settings of the item selected in the Inventory ID box; the system processes lines of different types in different ways. The following line types are available in drop-ship orders: Goods for Drop-Ship : The system assigns this line type to all stock items. Lines of this type are copied to purchase receipts, where each Goods for Drop-Ship line must be linked to a sales order document. Non-Stock for Drop-Ship : The system assigns this line type to non-stock items that have both the Require Receipt and Require Shipment check boxes selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=IN202000|IN202000]) Non-Stock Items (IN202000) form. Lines of this type are copied to purchase receipts, where each Non-Stock for Drop-Ship line must be linked to a sales order document. Non-Stock : The system assigns this line type to non-stock items that have the Require Receipt check box selected and the Require Shipment check box cleared on the ([~/?ScreenId=IN202000|IN202000]) Non-Stock Items form. The Non-Stock lines are copied to purchase receipts and do not need to be linked to a sales order document. Service : The system assigns this line type to non-stock items that have the Require Receipt check box cleared on the ([~/?ScreenId=IN202000|IN202000]) Non-Stock Items form, and to lines in which no Inventory ID is specified. The way the system processes Service lines in drop-ship orders depends on whether the Process Service Lines from Drop-Ship Purchase Orders via Purchase Receipt check box is selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO101000|PO101000]) Purchase Orders Preferences (PO101000) form. For more details, see the next section. Freight : You can add a line without an Inventory ID specified and select this line type manually to record freight expenses for the order. Lines of this type are copied to purchase receipt, or could be added directly to purchase receipt, and do not need to be linked to a sales order document. The freight amount is posted to the Freight Expense account and subaccount specified on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO101000|PO101000]) Purchase Orders Preferences form. Description : You can add a line without an Inventory ID specified and select this line type manually. These lines are used for informational purposes. Lines of this type are not copied to purchase receipts. Kits cannot be drop-shipped, because they are manufactured in your company. Processing Service Lines in Drop-Ship Orders Depending on your business processes, you can select which workflow the system should use for processing Service lines. You select the needed workflow by using the Process Service Lines from Drop-Ship Purchase Orders via Purchase Receipt check box on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO101000|PO101000]) Purchase Orders Preferences (PO101000) form as follows: If the check box is selected, you can process Service lines through purchase receipts: When you create a purchase receipt for the drop-ship purchase order, the non-stock lines of the Service type that haven't been billed to the vendor yet are copied to the created purchase receipt. You cannot create an Accounts Payable bill for the Service lines for which the purchase receipt has not been created yet. Also, you can add lines of the Service type directly to purchase receipts without linking them to a purchase order and sales order. This setting gives you the ability to handle charges added by vendors of drop-ship orders when their goods are delivered to the customer. Your company will absorb these charges without again billing the customer for them. If the check box is cleared (the default setting), processing Service lines doesn't involve creating a purchase receipt an Accounts Payable bill (or multiple bills) has to be created directly from the drop-ship order. These lines do not have to be linked to a sales order. When you create a purchase receipt for a purchase order with lines of different types, the system does not copy Service lines to a purchase receipt prepared from a purchase order. Also, Service lines cannot be added to the purchase receipt manually. Processing Purchased Items for Sale If your company sells items that are purchased only when sales orders for these items exist, each sales order may result in multiple purchase orders for different vendors, and each purchase order may include items from multiple sales orders. These factors make it difficult to track the fulfillment of sales orders. In Acumatica ERP, if the Sales Order to Purchase Order Link feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form, you can easily link sales orders to existing purchase orders and receipts, to enable the tracking of sales order fulfillment. The system uses these links to allocate the items listed on purchase receipts for specific sales orders and to automate the creation of transfer orders, if needed. This functionality can be very helpful if you have multiple warehouses and perform purchasing only to particular larger warehouses (distribution centers)—the system will generate the required transfers between warehouses, and you can easily track where the particular sales order is in the fulfillment process. Sales order lines marked for purchase are not processed during the quick processing of a sales order. For more information, see Quick Processing of Sales Orders. Creating Sales Orders with Items Requested for Purchase If the quantity of an item added to a sales order is out of stock fully or partially, you can purchase the remaining quantity. You specify that the remaining quantity should be purchased for the order by selecting the Mark for PO check box for the line on the Document Details tab. The quantity initially allocated for the order remains allocated, while the quantity that must be purchased remains unallocated. Whether or not you can create partial shipments depends on the shipping rules specified for the orders lines and for the whole order. For more information, see Shipping Rule Combinations. Once you take the sales order off hold, the order appears on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO505000|PO505000]) Create Purchase Orders (PO505000) form and you can generate a purchase order which will be linked to the original sales order. Once receipts for the remaining quantities are released, you can allocate the initially unallocated quantities manually by using the Allocations dialog box on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form. Even if the Replan Back-Orders check box is selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=IN101000|IN101000]) Inventory Preferences, releasing inventory receipts does not update automatically plan types for sales orders with allocations (on release of receipts, the unallocated quantities still are shown as Back Ordered until you manually allocate them). Linking Sales Orders to Purchase Orders If you need to promptly fulfill a sales order line for which the quantity of the item is insufficient, or if the sales order includes an item that is purchased only for specific sales orders, you can mark the applicable lines for purchasing—that is, select the check box in the Mark for PO column. Also, after you have shipped the available quantity of an item, you may need to order the remaining quantity that was unavailable at the time of shipping; in this case, you also can select the Mark for PO check box for the line. In a sales order of the RR or RM type, only a line with the Issue operation can be marked for purchasing. You can include a sales order line that requires purchasing in a purchase order in one of the following ways: By using the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form: Select the sales order line, and then click Create Purchase Order on the Actions menu on the form toolbar. By using the ([~/?ScreenId=PO505000|PO505000]) Create Purchase Orders (SO505000) form: Select multiple lines of different sales orders to create multiple purchase orders for these sales orders. The system consolidates the item quantities and group the items by vendor as needed. You also can link the line of a sales order that has the Mark for PO check box selected to an existing purchase order that has not been completed yet. For instance, if you have created a new sales order that lists the same items as the existing purchase order does. If the purchase order has a quantity that exactly matches the total quantity on the sales orders that are already linked, you should first increase the quantity on the purchase order, and then link the sales order to this purchase order. Linking Purchase Receipts to Sales Orders The purchased items ordered in a sales order may be received to warehouses other than the warehouse specified on the sales order. If the users properly specify links between the purchase receipts and purchase orders, Acumatica ERP enables tracking of sales order fulfillment, reserves the received items for sales orders, and automates transfers of the items to the needed warehouses. To make it possible to track items from receipts to original sales orders, you need to link each receipt to the corresponding purchase order in one of the following ways: Open the purchase order on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders (PO301000) form, and create a receipt for it by selecting Enter PO Receipt from the Actions menu on the form toolbar. Create a receipt on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO302000|PO302000]) Purchase Receipts (PO302000) form, and link all the related purchase orders to this new receipt by clicking Add PO or Add PO Line on the table toolbar. To view the original sales orders linked to the purchase receipt, for each receipt line, click View PO on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO302000|PO302000]) Purchase Receipts form. A dialog box opens that displays the list of sales orders that are linked to the purchase orders on which this receipt is based. After a receipt has been properly linked to all the related purchase orders, you will be able to track the stage of fulfillment for each line of the original sales order by clicking Allocations on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders form. In the Allocations dialog box, which opens, you can view an allocation that the system automatically performs to reserve the line item quantity required for the sale order on the purchase receipt. In the Allocations dialog box, you can also view the reference numbers of the related documents in the Related Documents column: the purchase order and the receipt. (You can click any reference number of a related document to view the document.) If a purchase order line that corresponds to a sales order is completed or canceled, the system adds a new allocation line, which can be viewed in the Allocations dialog box on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders form. This line has the Mark for PO check box cleared and indicates that the shipment should be prepared for the item quantity in this line. When the shipment is confirmed for this line, the line is removed from the Allocations dialog box. On release of the receipt, the quantities of items required for the sales orders are deducted from the item quantities available for shipping. If items are received to a warehouse other than the warehouse specified on the sales order, the system will generate a transfer request, which you can use to create a transfer order by using the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders form for a single transfer order, or on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO509000|SO509000]) Create Transfer Orders form for multiple transfer orders. For details, see To Create a Transfer Order (TR) and To Create Shipments for Multiple Orders.

Processing Direct Sales and Returns A point-of-sale (POS) system is an electronic system that is used to record the sales, payments, and return transactions of a retail store. The POS system can be operated by a cashier or can be a self-service terminal where customers perform all operations by themselves. When a customer pays for goods and services, the POS system processes a direct sales invoice to record the sale (that is, an invoice that updates inventory without a sales order and a shipment being processed). For simplified processing of direct sales with the integration of an external POS system, the Advanced SO Invoices feature should be enabled in Acumatica ERP on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form. With this feature enabled, a user can add stock items directly to a Sales Orders invoice without creating and processing the associated sales order and shipment. Entry of a Direct Sale If the Advanced SO Invoices feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form, a user can add lines with stock items directly to an invoice on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices (SO303000) form. With this feature enabled, the following columns, which should be filled in for a direct invoice, appear on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices (SO303000) form: Warehouse ID : This column is mandatory if the Multiple Warehouses feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features form. Location : This column is mandatory if the Multiple Warehouse Locations feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features form. Lot/Serial Nbr. and Expiration Date : These columns appear if the Lot and Serial Tracking feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features form. If the item selected in the line is lot- or serial-tracked, these columns could be mandatory or optional, depending on the item settings. For a serialized item added to a direct invoice, for each serial number, the user should add a separate invoice line with this item and a quantity of 1. For more information on configuring and processing lot- and serial-tracked items, see Lot and Serial Numbers. In sales invoices created from sales orders or shipments, the listed columns are automatically filled in by the system and are not available for editing. Sales Lines Linked to a Sales Order A sales line in an invoice (that is, a line that represents a sold rather than returned item) could be linked to a sales order or not linked to any order. If a line of the direct sales invoice is linked to an open line of a sales order, the release of the invoice functions as a shipment does for the linked sales order line: On release of the invoice, the system updates the Shipped Qty. in the sales order line based on the quantity specified in the invoice line, and inserts the reference number of the Sales Orders invoice on the Shipments tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form. Return Lines in a Direct Sales Invoice Return lines in an invoice are lines that represent returned rather than sold items. In direct invoices of the Invoice , Credit Memo , and Debit Memo type created on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices (SO303000) form, lines with different signs (that is, sales and return lines) can be combined in one document. In this case, the inventory operation for the inventory document to be generated is defined on the line level. The lines with a positive quantity are processed in the usual way. The lines with a negative quantity are processed as lines of a reversing document (that is, the generated General Ledger batch contains the same transactions as it would in a reversing document). You can also link a return line to the original sales invoice. When a document with a return line is released, the system generates an inventory issue, with the date and posting period of the invoice, that returns the item to inventory. General Workflow and Related Documents For a Sales Orders invoice created for processing a direct sale or return, the typical processing involves the actions and generated documents shown in the following diagram. The following sections describe in detail the processing steps shown in the diagram. Entering a direct Sales Orders invoice You enter a direct Sales Orders invoice on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices (SO303000) form. For stock items to be sold, you specify the positive quantity in a line; lines with a negative quantity are processed as returns of the selected items. If the invoice is created with the On Hold status, you should clear the Hold check box for the invoice so you can process it further. You can print the SO invoice by clicking Reports > Print Invoice on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices form. Releasing the direct SO invoice To release the SO invoice, you click Actions > Release on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices (SO303000) form. When the SO invoice is released, a batch of General Ledger transactions is generated; also, the system automatically generates an inventory issue for the stock items with the date and posting period of the SO invoice. For sales lines in the invoice, the system creates inventory issue lines with the Invoice or Debit Memo transaction type that issue the items from inventory. For return lines in the invoice, the system creates inventory issue lines with the Credit Memo transaction type that add returned items to inventory. Also, after the SO invoice release, the related Accounts Receivable invoice becomes available for review on the ([~/?ScreenId=AR301000|AR301000]) Invoices and Memos (AR301000) form. Releasing the inventory issue The generated inventory issue is released automatically if the Automatically Release IN Documents check box is selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO101000|SO101000]) Sales Orders Preferences (SO101000) form. If this check box is cleared, you have to release the inventory issue manually by clicking Release on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=IN302000|IN302000]) Issues (IN302000) form while viewing the issue. On release of the inventory issue, a batch of General Ledger Transactions is generated. Integration with External POS Systems Acumatica ERP provides a contract-based SOAP API for implementing integration with external POS systems. For code examples, see Integration of Acumatica ERP with POS systems (SOAP API Examples). ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000])

To Create a Direct Sales Invoice If you use integration with a point-of-sale system, you can process the sale of stock items in the retail store directly through a Sales Orders invoice that you create on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices (SO303000) form. To open any form, you can navigate to it or search for it (by its name or by its form ID without periods). For more information about search capabilities, see Search in the Modern UI. To Process a Direct Sales Invoice Open the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices (SO303000) form by searching for or navigating to it. On the form toolbar, click Add New Record . In the Type box of the Summary area, select Invoice . Select the customer. Optional: In the Location box, check the default location of the customer, and change it if needed for the order. Optional: Check the currency and the currency exchange rate; change these in the Currency box, if needed. If this sales invoice is associated with a particular project or contract, in the Project/Contract box, change X (the non-project code, which is inserted by default) to the code of a particular project. In the Date box, change the date of the invoice (which by default is the current business date) if needed. The Post Period box is filled in automatically based on the selected document date. Optional: In the Customer Order box, enter the reference number of the original customer document the sales invoice is based on. In the Terms box, check the credit terms associated with the customer. Optional: In the Description box, add a brief description of the invoice. On the Document Details tab, enter the details of the invoice by doing the following for each line you want to add: Click Add Row on the table toolbar. In the Inventory ID column, enter the ID of the inventory item sold to the customer. Optional: In the Transaction Descr. column, modify the description of the transaction. In the Quantity column, enter the quantity of the item sold. Review the Warehouse and Location columns, and change these if needed. Optional: Specify a lot or serial number for the item to be sold. Optional: In the UOM column, change the unit of measure for the item. Optional: In the Unit Price column, change the price per unit. Optional: In the Discount Amount box, review the line discount to be provided to the customer. If you want to change the discount to be offered, change the Discount Percent or Discount Amount in the line. Check the Amount column, which displays the total for the line item, which the system calculates by deducting the discount amount (if any) from the line amount. Check the Account column and the Subaccount column (if applicable); by default, the system uses the sales account and subaccount of the customer. You can change these settings, if needed. Check the salesperson associated with the customer. You can change the salesperson, if needed. Optional: Select the Commission check box if a commission is paid on the line item amount. In the Cash Discount box in the Summary area, check the cash discount amount offered for the invoice. This box may be filled in automatically, based on the credit terms of the customer. Optional: If you want to save the invoice with the On Hold status, select the Hold check box. On the form toolbar, click Save . Notes About the Procedure The notes in this section describe the nuances of the UI elements available on the form, such as when an element is required and when it is not, and when the system fills in settings by default. This section can include other notes. Note the following about creating a direct sales invoice: You can enter a direct invoice with inventory items only if the Advanced SO Invoices feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form. For a sale of serialized items through a direct invoice, a separate invoice line with this item and a quantity of 1.00 should be created for each serial number. If you enter a discount percentage manually in an invoice line, the system calculates the discount amount automatically by multiplying the total line amount by the discount percentage. If you specify a negative quantity in a line of a direct invoice of the Invoice type, the return of the item to inventory is processed on the release of this direct invoice. Alternatively, you can process a sale return as a line with positive quantity in a direct invoice of the Credit Memo type. For detailed instruction, see To Create a Direct Return.

To Create a Direct Return If you use integration with a point-of-sale system, you can process the return of stock items to the retail store directly through a Sales Orders invoice of the Credit Memo type that you create on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices (SO303000) form. To open any form, you can navigate to it or search for it (by its name or by its form ID without periods). For more information about search capabilities, see Search in the Modern UI. To Process a Direct Return Open the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices (SO303000) form by searching for or navigating to it. On the form toolbar, click Add New Record . In the Type box of the Summary area, select Credit Memo . Select the customer. Optional: In the Location box, check the default location of the customer, and change it if needed for the order. Optional: Check the currency and the currency exchange rate; change these in the Currency box, if needed. If this sales invoice is associated with a particular project or contract, in the Project/Contract box, change X (the non-project code, which is inserted by default) to the code of a particular project. In the Date box, change the date of the invoice (which by default is the current business date) if needed. The Post Period box is filled in automatically based on the selected document date. Optional: In the Customer Order box, enter the reference number of the original customer document the sales invoice is based on. In the Terms box, check the credit terms associated with the customer. Optional: In the Description box, add a brief description of the invoice. On the Document Details tab, enter the details of the invoice by doing the following for each line you want to add: Click Add Row on the table toolbar. In the Inventory ID column, enter the ID of the inventory item returned by the customer. Optional: In the Transaction Descr. column, modify the description of the transaction and enter the reason for the return. In the Quantity column, enter the quantity of the item, expressed as a positive integer. Review the Warehouse and Location columns, and change these if needed. Optional: Specify the lot or serial number of the returned item. Optional: In the UOM column, change the unit of measure for the item. Optional: In the Unit Price column, change the price per unit. Check the Account column and the Subaccount column (if applicable); by default, the system uses the sales account and subaccount of the customer. You can change these settings, if needed. Optional: If you want to save the invoice with the On Hold status, in the Summary area, select the Hold check box. On the form toolbar, click Save . Notes About the Procedure The notes in this section describe the nuances of the UI elements available on the form, such as when an element is required and when it is not, and when the system fills in settings by default. This section can include other notes. Note the following about creating a direct return: You can enter a direct invoice with inventory items only if the Advanced SO Invoices feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form. For a sale of serialized items through a direct invoice, a separate invoice line with this item and a quantity of 1.00 should be created for each serial number. If you enter a discount percentage manually in an invoice line, the system calculates the discount amount automatically by multiplying the total line amount by the discount percentage. If you specify a negative quantity in a line of a direct invoice of the Credit Memo type, the sale of the item is processed on release of this direct invoice. Alternatively, you can process a sale of an item as a line with positive quantity in the direct invoice of the Invoice type. For detailed instruction, see To Create a Direct Sales Invoice.

row.PlainText: Processing Customer Returns Acumatica ERP gives you the flexibility to manage various types of customer returns. In general, the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form is the starting point for entering return orders of any of the predefined types. Depending on your company's return policies, you select the predefined order type that best suits your needs. The topics of this chapter describes how to process a return of inventory items. In This Chapter Return for Credit with ReceiptReturn for Credit Without ReceiptReturn for CashReturn for Exact ReplacementMerchandise Authorization Return

row.column: Return for Credit with Receipt Acumatica ERP gives you the flexibility to manage various types of customer returns. Depending on your company's return policies, you may need to perform a return for credit with receiving the returned items to inventory. For this purpose, you an use a return order for credit (that is, an order with the RC predefined order type). This topic describes the processing steps you need to perform, and the transactions generated during these steps. The processing of a return order for credit involves the actions generated documents shown in the following diagram. The following sections describe in detail the processing steps shown in the diagram. 1. Enter the Return Order for Credit You create a new return order for credit is created on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form. A reference number for the new return order is generated according to the numbering sequence assigned to this order type on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO201000|SO201000]) Order Types (SO201000) form. If the order is created with the On Hold status, you should clear the Hold check box for the order to process it further. 2. Link the Original Invoice Line to the Order Each line in the return order of the RC order type can include a reference to the original invoice for which the return is performed. To add an item to be returned and include a link to original invoice, on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form, you click Add Invoice on the table toolbar of the Document Details tab and select the line of the needed invoice in the Add Invoice Details dialog box (which opens). If an item to be returned has a specific lot or serial number, you should select this particular item from the list of invoice lines. You can also add a stock item to be returned without linking it to an invoice. To do this, click Add Stock Item on the table toolbar of the Document Details tab, and select the item in the Inventory Lookup dialog box (which opens). 3. Prepare the Receipt A receipt of the items returned to inventory is processed in the system as a shipment document with the Receipt operation type. To create a receipt (also referred to as an incoming shipment ), you click Actions Create Receipt on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form. The prepared incoming shipment can be reviewed on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO302000|SO302000]) Shipments (SO302000) form. 4. Confirm the Receipt You can confirm an incoming shipment for a particular order by clicking Actions Confirm Shipment on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO302000|SO302000]) Shipments (SO302000) form; to confirm multiple incoming shipments, you can execute the Confirm Shipment action for the selected shipments on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO503000|SO503000]) Process Shipments (SO503000) form. 5. Prepare the Sales Orders Invoice You prepare the Sales Orders invoice by clicking Actions Prepare Invoice on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form, or you can create invoices by running the Prepare Invoice action for multiple selected orders on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO501000|SO501000]) Process Orders (SO501000) form. The prepared document or documents of the Credit Memo type can be reviewed on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices (SO303000) form. You can print a Sales Orders invoice by clicking Reports > Print Invoice on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices (SO303000) form. 6. Release the Sales Orders Invoice To release the Sales Orders invoice, you click Actions > Release on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices (SO303000) form. When the Sales Orders invoice is released, a batch of General Ledger transactions is generated. Also, when the SO invoice is released, the system automatically generates an inventory issue with the Credit Memo transaction type. Also, the related Accounts Receivable credit memo with the same reference number becomes available for reviewing on the ([~/?ScreenId=AR301000|AR301000]) Invoices and Memos (AR301000) form. 7. Release the Inventory Issue The generated inventory issue is released automatically if the Automatically Release IN Documents check box is selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO101000|SO101000]) Sales Orders Preferences (SO101000) form. If this check box is cleared, you have to release the inventory issue manually by clicking Release on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=IN302000|IN302000]) Issues (IN302000) form. On release of the inventory issue, a batch of General Ledger transactions is generated. To finish the return process, you need to process the Accounts Receivable credit memo to completion. You can apply the credit memo to the original invoice, or process the customer refund if the original invoice was already paid. For details on credit memo application, see To Apply a Credit Memo. For details on processing of a customer refund, see To Issue a Refund.

To Create a Return for Credit Order (RC) To credit a customer for returned goods, you enter a return for credit order (that is, an order of the RC order type) by using the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form. To open any form, you can navigate to it or search for it (by its name or by its form ID without periods). For more information about search capabilities, see Search in the Modern UI. To Enter a Return for Credit Order Open the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form by searching for or navigating to it. In the Summary area, select RC as the order type. Select the customer in the Customer box. Check the location of the customer in the order, and change it if needed. Check the currency and the currency exchange rate on the corresponding document from the customer, and change these in the order if needed. Notice the non-project code that is shown in the Project box; if this order is associated with a particular project, select the project. Check the date of the order, and change it if needed. In the Requested on box, specify the date of the customer document. In the Description box, provide a brief description of this return order. On the Document Details tab, add all the invoices that list the items that have been returned for credit. For each invoice, click Add Invoice on the table toolbar and perform the following steps: In the Reference Nbr. box of the Add Invoice Details dialog box, which opens, select the customer invoice by its identifier. Once the line or lines of the selected document appear in the table, select the unlabeled check box to the left of each line with an item to be returned. Click the Add & Close button to add selected lines to the order (on the Document Details tab) and close the dialog box. Click Save on the form toolbar. Optional: To add items to be returned without linking them to invoices, perform the following steps for each item: On the Document Details tab, click Add Stock Item on the table toolbar. The Inventory Lookup dialog box appears with a list of active inventory items. In the dialog box, to find the item by a string in its inventory ID or description, type this string in the Inventory box. To further narrow the list to a particular subitem of the item (if subitems are used in your system), select it in the Subitem box. In the resulting list of items, select the unlabeled check box in the row of the item you want to add, and in the Qty. Selected column, specify the requested quantity of the item (measured in the sales unit of measure shown in the Sales Unit column). Click the Add & Close button, which adds the items and closes the dialog box. Click Save on the form toolbar. Clear the Hold check box in the Summary area of the form. Click Save on the form toolbar. To view and add particular stock items of non-stock kits in the Inventory Lookup dialog box, select the Show Non-Stock Kits by Components check box.

To Process a Return for Credit Order (RC) To credit a customer for returned goods, you process a return for credit order (that is, an order of the RC order type) by using the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form. To open any form, you can navigate to it or search for it (by its name or by its form ID without periods). For more information about search capabilities, see Search in the Modern UI. To Process the Return for Credit Order Open the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form by searching for or navigating to it. In the Summary area, select the order to be processed by specifying its type ( RC ) and reference number. On the form toolbar, click Actions Create Receipt to create an incoming shipment (with the Receipt operation) that accounts for the returned goods. The system opens the ([~/?ScreenId=SO302000|SO302000]) Shipments (SO302000) form to display the new shipment with the Receipt operation selected in the Summary area. On the opened form, review the shipment details, clear the Hold check box in the Summary area, and click Save on the form toolbar. Click Actions Confirm Shipment to confirm the shipment. Click Actions Prepare Invoice . The system generates a credit memo with the returned items listed and system opens the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices (SO303000) form to display the new document. On this form, release the credit memo by clicking Actions Release on the form toolbar. This creates an issue transaction of the Credit Memo type in the Inventory module. Once you release the credit memo, the original RC order gets the Completed status.

Return for Credit Without Receipt Acumatica ERP gives you the flexibility to manage various types of customer returns. Depending on your company's return policies, you may need to perform a return for credit when shipping of returned items to inventory is not needed. This topic describes the processing steps you need to perform, and the transactions generated during these steps. To process an unauthorized return without receipt and shipment, you can use a credit memo order ( CM ). The processing of a return for credit involves the actions and generated documents shown in the following diagram. The following sections describe in detail the processing steps shown in the diagram. 1. Enter the Credit Memo Order You create a new credit memo order on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form. A reference number for the new return order is generated according to the numbering sequence assigned to this order type on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO201000|SO201000]) Order Types (SO201000) form. If the order is created with the On Hold status, you should clear the Hold check box for the order to process it further. 2. Link the Original Invoice Line to the Order Each line in the order of the CM order type can include a reference to the original invoice for which the return is performed. To add an item to be returned and include a link to original invoice, on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form, you can click Add Invoice on the table toolbar of the Document Details tab and select the line of the needed invoice in the Add Invoice Details dialog box (which opens). You can also add a stock item to be returned without linking it to an invoice. To do this, click Add Stock Item on the table toolbar of the Document Details tab, and select the item in the Inventory Lookup dialog box (which opens). 3. Prepare the Sales Orders Invoice You can prepare the Sales Orders (SO) invoice by clicking Actions Prepare Invoice on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form, or you can create any number of invoices by running the Prepare Invoice action for multiple selected orders on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO501000|SO501000]) Process Orders (SO501000) form. The prepared document or documents of the Credit Memo type can be reviewed on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices (SO303000) form. You can print an SO invoice by clicking Reports > Print Invoice on the form toolbar of this form. 4. Release the Sales Orders Invoice For the credit memo order, the released Sales Orders invoice acts as a shipment does: On release of the invoice, the system updates the Qty. on Shipments value in the order lines based on the quantity specified in the credit memo lines, and inserts the reference number of the Sales Orders credit memo on the Shipments tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form. When the SO invoice is released, a batch of General Ledger transactions is generated, and the system automatically generates an inventory issue with the Credit Memo transaction type that adds the returned item to inventory. Also, a corresponding Accounts Receivable credit memo is generated and becomes available for review on the ([~/?ScreenId=AR301000|AR301000]) Invoices and Memos (AR301000) form. 5. Release the Inventory Issue The generated inventory issue is released automatically if the Automatically Release IN Documents check box is selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO101000|SO101000]) Sales Orders Preferences (SO101000) form. If this check box is cleared, you have to release the inventory issue manually by clicking Release on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=IN302000|IN302000]) Issues (IN302000) form. On release of the inventory issue, a batch of General Ledger Transactions is generated. To finish the return process, you need to process Accounts Receivable credit memo to completion. You can apply the credit memo to the original invoice, or process the customer refund if the original invoice was already paid. For details on credit memo application, see To Apply a Credit Memo. For details on the processing of a customer refund, see To Issue a Refund.

Return for Cash Acumatica ERP gives you the flexibility to manage various types of customer returns. Depending on your company's return policies, you may need to perform a return of an inventory item for cash. This topic describes the processing steps you need to perform, and the transactions generated during these steps. To process a return for cash, you can use a return order for cash (that is, an order with the CR predefined order type). The processing of a return for cash involves the actions and generated documents shown in the following diagram. The following sections describe in detail the processing steps shown in the diagram. 1. Enter the Return Order for Cash You create a new return order for cash on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form. A reference number for the new return order for cash is generated according to the numbering sequence assigned to this order type on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO201000|SO201000]) Order Types (SO201000) form. If the order is created with the On Hold status, you should clear the Hold check box to process it further. 2. Link the Original Invoice Line to the Order Each line in the order of the CR order type can include a reference to the original invoice for which the return is performed. To add an item to be returned with a link to the original invoice, on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form, you can click Add Invoice on the table toolbar of the Document Details tab and select the line of the needed invoice in the Add Invoice Details dialog box (which opens). If an item to be returned has a specific lot or serial number, you should select this particular item from the list of invoice lines. You can also add a stock item to be returned without linking it to an invoice. To do this, click Add Stock Item on the table toolbar of the Document Details tab, and select an item in the Inventory Lookup dialog box (which opens). In each line added on the Document Details tab for an order of the CR type, you must specify a reason code. Also, the payment information on the Payment Settings tab is required for the cash return. 3. Prepare the Sales Orders Invoice You can prepare the Sales Orders (SO) invoice by clicking Actions Prepare Invoice on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form, or you can create multiple invoices by running the Prepare Invoice action for multiple selected orders on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO501000|SO501000]) Process Orders (SO501000) form. The prepared document or documents of the Cash Return type can be reviewed on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices (SO303000) form. You can print an SO invoice by clicking Reports > Print Invoice on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices (SO303000) form. 4. Release the Sales Orders Invoice When the Sales Orders invoice of the Cash Return type is released, the system automatically generates an inventory issue with the Credit Memo transaction type that adds the returned item to inventory; you can review the generated issue on the ([~/?ScreenId=IN302000|IN302000]) Issues (IN302000) form. Also, the related Accounts Receivable cash return with the same reference number becomes available for reviewing on the ([~/?ScreenId=AR304000|AR304000]) Cash Sales (AR304000) form. The document updates the appropriate sales and cash accounts. 5. Release the Inventory Issue The generated inventory issue is released automatically if the Automatically Release IN Documents check box is selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO101000|SO101000]) Sales Orders Preferences form. If this check box is cleared, you have to release the inventory issue manually by clicking Release on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=IN302000|IN302000]) Issues (IN302000) form. On release of the inventory issue, a batch of General Ledger Transactions is generated.

Return for Exact Replacement Acumatica ERP gives you the flexibility to manage various types of customer returns. Depending on your company's return policies, you may need to authorize a customer return in which the customer receives an exact replacement of a particular item or items. For this purpose, you can use a return order for replacement, and a printed or electronic copy of this document can be sent to the customer. The customer then returns the rejected goods according to this order, the goods are returned to inventory, and the customer receives a replacement for the rejected goods. This topic describes the processing steps you need to perform, and the transactions generated during these steps. To process a return for exact replacement, you use a return order for replacement (that is, an order with the RR predefined order type). The processing of a return order for replacement involves the actions and generated documents shown in the diagram below. The following sections describe in detail the processing steps shown in the diagram. 1. Enter the Return Order for Replacement A new return order for replacement of the RR predefined type is created on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form. A reference number for the new return order is generated according to the numbering sequence assigned to this order type on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO201000|SO201000]) Order Types (SO201000) form. If the order is created with the On Hold status, you should clear the Hold check box for the order to process it further. 2. Link the Original Invoice Line to the Order Each return line in the order of the RR order type can include a reference to the original Sales Orders invoice for which the return is performed. To add an item to be returned and include a link to original invoice, on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form, you can click Add Invoice on the table toolbar of the Document Details tab and select the line of the needed invoice in the Add Invoice Details dialog box (which opens). You can also add a stock item to be returned without linking it to an invoice. To do this, click Add Stock Item on the table toolbar of the Document Details tab, and select the item in the Inventory Lookup dialog box (which opens). 3. Add a Line with the Item for Replacement An added return line (linked or not linked to an invoice) has the Receipt operation specified in the Operation column. Each line with the Receipt operation type in an RR order should have a corresponding line with the Issue operation type for a replacement item. If the item in a Receipt -type line is not tracked by serial or lot numbers, you can select the Auto-Create Issue check box for the line; then (when the shipment is confirmed) the system will automatically add the corresponding Issue -type lines with the details copied from the Receipt -type lines. If the items to be returned have specific lot or serial numbers, clear the Auto-Create Issue check box for the line, and add an Issue -type line for the replacement line manually. 4. Prepare the Receipt A receipt of the items returned to inventory is processed in the system as a shipment document with the Receipt operation type. To create a receipt (also referred to as an incoming shipment ), you click Actions Create Receipt on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form. The prepared incoming shipment can be reviewed on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO302000|SO302000]) Shipments (SO302000) form. 5. Confirm the Receipt You can confirm an incoming shipment for a particular order by clicking Actions Confirm Shipment on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO302000|SO302000]) Shipments (SO302000) form; to confirm multiple incoming shipments, you can execute the Confirm Shipment action for the selected shipments on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO503000|SO503000]) Process Shipments (SO503000) form. 6. Prepare the Shipment with the Replacement Item You prepare the shipment with the Issue operation type by clicking Actions Create Shipment on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form. Alternatively, you can use the ([~/?ScreenId=SO501000|SO501000]) Process Orders (SO501000) form to create shipments for multiple orders by executing the Create Shipment action for the selected return orders. The prepared shipment can be reviewed on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO302000|SO302000]) Shipments (SO302000) form. You can print a pick list for a particular shipment by using the ([~/?ScreenId=SO302000|SO302000]) Shipments form. For multiple shipments with the On Hold and Open statuses, you can print pick lists by using the ([~/?ScreenId=SO503000|SO503000]) Process Shipments (SO503000) form. For more details, see Shipment Processing Steps. 7. Confirm the Shipment You can confirm a shipment for a particular order by clicking Actions Confirm Shipment on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO302000|SO302000]) Shipments (SO302000) form; to confirm multiple shipments, you can execute the Confirm Shipment action for the selected shipments on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO503000|SO503000]) Process Shipments (SO503000) form. 8. Update Inventory You can update inventory for each shipment separately by opening the shipment on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO302000|SO302000]) Shipments (SO302000) form and clicking Actions Update IN to generate the appropriate inventory transaction and to update the item availability data. Alternatively, you can use the ([~/?ScreenId=SO503000|SO503000]) Process Shipments(SO503000) form to update inventory by executing the Update IN action for the selected shipments. Notice that Sales Orders invoices and Accounts Receivable invoices are not generated for an RR order because the returned item is replaced with another item with no price changes. 9. Release the Inventory Issues The generated inventory issues are released automatically if the Automatically Release IN Documents check box is selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO101000|SO101000]) Sales Orders Preferences (SO101000) form. If this check box is cleared, you have to release the inventory issues manually by clicking Release on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=IN302000|IN302000]) Issues (IN302000) form for each of the inventory issues. On release of the inventory issues, batches of General Ledger transactions are generated.

To Create a Return Order with Replacement (RR) To authorize a return with replacement of the same item or a similar item (or multiple items) when no additional charges are involved, you create an order of the RR type by using the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form. To open any form, you can navigate to it or search for it (by its name or by its form ID without periods). For more information about search capabilities, see Search in the Modern UI. To Create a Return with Replacement Order Open the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form by searching for or navigating to it. In the Summary area, select RR as the order type. Select the customer in the Customer box. Check the location of the customer in the order, and change it if needed. Check the currency and the currency exchange rate on the corresponding document from the customer, and change these in the order if needed. Notice the non-project code that is shown in the Project box; if this order is associated with a particular project, select the project. Check the date of the order, and change it if needed. In the Requested on box, specify the date of the customer document. Provide a brief description of this return order. On the Document Details tab, add all the invoices that list the items to be returned. For each invoice, click Add Invoice on the table toolbar and perform the following steps: In Ref. Number box of the Add Invoice Details dialog box, which opens, select the customer invoice by its reference number. Once the line or lines of the selected invoice appear in the table, select the unlabeled check boxes to the left of each line with an item that is being returned. To view and add particular stock items of non-stock kits, select the Show Non-Stock Kits by Components check box. Click the Add & Close button to add the selected lines to the order (on the Document Details tab) and close the dialog box. In the Operation column for the added line or lines, make sure that Receipt is selected. Click Save on the form toolbar. Optional: To add other items that will be returned, perform the following steps for each item: On the Document Details tab, click Add Stock Item on the table toolbar. The Inventory Lookup dialog box appears with a list of active inventory items. In the dialog box, to find the item by a string in its inventory ID or description, type this string in the Inventory box. To further narrow the list to a particular subitem of the item (if subitems are used in your system), select it in the Subitem box. In the resulting list of items, select the unlabeled check box in the row of the item you want to add, and in the Qty. Selected column, specify the requested quantity of the item (measured in the default unit of measure shown in the UOM column). Click the Add & Close button, which closes the dialog box. In the Operation column, make sure that Receipt is selected. Click Save on the form toolbar. On the Document Details tab, for each row with an item that will be replaced with other units (or another unit) of the same item, make sure the Auto Create Issue check box is selected. For items that are tracked by lot or serial numbers, always select the Auto Create Issue check box. For the rows with the Auto Create Issue check box cleared, add new rows for the replacement items as follows: Click Add Stock Item on the table toolbar.
