Optional: Type its subitem (if subitems are used in your system) in the Subitem box. In the resulting list of items, select the unlabeled check box in the row with the information about the item, and in the Qty. Selected column, specify the quantity of the replacement item. Click the Add & Close button, which closes the dialog box. Click Save on the form toolbar. Clear the Hold check box in the Summary area of the form. Click Save on the form toolbar. When you create an order of the RR type, make sure that for each line with the Receipt transaction type, the order has a line with Issue as the transaction type for a replacement item. You can add thees lines manually (at this point, you can select other items for replacement), or you can select the Auto-Create Issue check box for each Receipt -type line (for items that are not tracked by serial or lot numbers) to make the system add the lines of the Issue type automatically.

Merchandise Authorization Return Acumatica ERP gives you the flexibility to manage various types of customer returns. Depending on your company's return policies, you may need to perform a merchandise authorization return of an inventory item for possible credit and replacement. For this purpose, you an use a merchandise authorization return order, and you can send the customer a printed or electronic copy of it along with the goods to be returned. Once the goods are received by your organization, they are returned to inventory, and the customer receives other goods instead. For this type of return order, different items than those returned may be included for replacement, freight and shipping and handling charges may be included, and the items could be returned at higher or lower prices. To process a merchandise authorization return, you can use a return order of the RM predefined order type. The processing of a RM order (further in this topic referred to as a return order ) involves the actions and generated documents shown in the following diagram. The following sections describe in detail the processing steps shown in the diagram. 1. Enter the Merchandise Return Order You create a new return order of the RM order type on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form. A reference number for the new return order is generated according to the numbering sequence assigned to this order type on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO201000|SO201000]) Order Types (SO201000) form. If the order is created with the On Hold status, you should clear the Hold check box for the order to process it further. 2. Link the Original Invoice Line to the Order Each return line in an order of the RM order type could include a reference to the original invoice for which the return is performed. To add an item to be returned and include a link to the original invoice, on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form, you can click Add Invoice on the table toolbar of the Document Details tab and select the line of the needed invoice in the Add Invoice Details dialog box (which opens). You can also add a stock item to be returned without linking it to an invoice. To do this, click Add Stock Item on the table toolbar of the Document Details tab, and select the item in the Inventory Lookup dialog box (which opens). An added return line (whether or not it is linked to an invoice) has the Receipt operation specified in the Operation column. After you have added the Receipt lines, make sure that the Auto-Create Issue check box is cleared in these lines (because you need to add replacement items and specify their details manually). 3. Add a Line with the Item for Replacement Each line with the Receipt transaction type in an RM order should have a corresponding line with the Issue operation type for a replacement item. You need to add an Issue -type line for the replacement lines manually. Alternatively, if the returned item is not tracked by serial or lot numbers, and the item price wasn't changed between the original sale and return, you can select the Auto-Create Issue check box for the line; on shipment confirmation, the system will add the corresponding Issue -type lines automatically and copy the line details from the Receipt -type lines. 4a–4b. Process the Return and the Replacement To complete the order, you need to process the receipt of the returned item and the shipment of the replacement item. You can process the return and replacement in any order on its own, or you can process multiple returns and replacements simultaneously on mass-processing forms. You perform the following general steps for processing: Prepare the receipt (for return) and the shipment (for replacement) by doing the following: You prepare the receipt (that is, the incoming shipment with the Receipt operation type) by clicking Actions Create Receipt on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders(SO301000) form. You prepare the outgoing shipment with the Issue operation type by clicking Actions Create Shipment on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders form. The prepared shipment can be reviewed on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO302000|SO302000]) Shipments (SO302000) form. Alternatively, you can use the ([~/?ScreenId=SO501000|SO501000]) Process Orders (SO501000) form to create both incoming and outgoing shipments for one order or multiple orders. To do this, you select the Create Shipment action, select the needed orders, and click Process on the form toolbar. Confirm the receipt and the shipment. You can confirm a particular receipt or shipment by clicking Actions Confirm Shipment on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO302000|SO302000]) Shipments form; to confirm multiple shipments, you can select the Confirm Shipment action, select the needed shipments, and click Process on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO503000|SO503000]) Process Shipments (SO503000) form. Prepare the Sales Orders invoices. You prepare the Sales Orders invoice for a particular receipt or shipment by clicking Actions Prepare Invoice on the form toolbar on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO302000|SO302000]) Shipments form, or you can create invoices by processing the Prepare Invoice action for multiple selected shipments on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO503000|SO503000]) Process Shipments form. The prepared document or documents can be reviewed on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices (SO303000) form. For the return, the system generates a Sales Orders invoice of the Credit Memo type; for the shipment, the system generates a Sales Orders invoice of the Invoice type. You can print a Sales Orders invoice by clicking Reports > Print Invoice on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices form. Release the Sales Orders invoices. When the Sales Orders invoices are released, the system automatically generates two inventory issues: one with the Return transaction type for the return, and one with the Issue transaction type for replacement. Also, the related Accounts Receivable credit memo and invoice with the same reference numbers become available for reviewing on the ([~/?ScreenId=AR301000|AR301000]) Invoices and Memos (AR301000) form. Once you release the Sales Orders invoices, the original RM order is assigned the Completed status. Release the generated inventory issues. The generated inventory issues are released automatically if the Automatically Release IN Documents check box is selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO101000|SO101000]) Sales Orders Preferences (SO101000) form. If this check box is cleared, you have to release each inventory issue manually by clicking Release on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=IN302000|IN302000]) Issues (IN302000) form. On release of each inventory issue, a batch of the General Ledger transactions is generated.

To Create a Merchandise Authorization Return Order (RM) On the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form, you can create a merchandise authorized return—an order document of the RM order type—when a customer wants to replace any returned item with an item with a higher price, or when shipping and handling fees are charged for returns. To open any form, you can navigate to it or search for it (by its name or by its form ID without periods). For more information about search capabilities, see Search in the Modern UI. To Create an Authorized Return Order Open the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form by searching for or navigating to it. In the Summary area of the form, select RM as the order type. Select the customer in the Customer box. Check the location of the customer in the order, and change it if needed. Check the currency and the currency exchange rate on the corresponding document from the customer, and change these in the order if needed. Notice the non-project code that is shown in the Project box; if this order is associated with a particular project, select the project. Check the date of the order, and change it if needed. In the Requested on box, specify the date of the customer document. In the Description box, provide a brief description of this return order. On the Document Details tab, add all the invoices that list the items to be returned. For each invoice, click Add Invoice on the table toolbar and perform the following steps: In the Reference Nbr. box of the Add Invoice Details dialog box, which opens, select the customer invoice by its identifier. Once the line or lines of the selected invoice appear in the table, select the unlabeled check boxes to the left of each line with an item that is being returned. To view and add particular stock items of non-stock kits, select the Show Non-Stock Kits by Components check box. Click the Add & Close button to add the selected lines to the order (on the Document Details tab) and close the dialog box. For each added line, in the Operation column, make sure that Receipt is selected. In the Summary area, notice the warning indicated by a red circle at the Order Total box. Point to the mark to read the warning: Document balance will go negative. Document will not be released. Until you add a replacement line (of the Issue type) or multiple lines of this type to make the order balance positive, you can save the document only with the On Hold status. Select the Hold check box, and save the order. Optional: To add other items that will be returned, perform the following steps for each item: On the Document Details tab, click Add Stock Item on the table toolbar. The Inventory Lookup dialog box appears with a list of active inventory items. In the dialog box, to find the item by a string in its inventory ID or description, type this string in the Inventory box. To further narrow the list to a particular subitem of the item (if subitems are used in your system), select it in the Subitem box. In the resulting list of items, select the unlabeled check box in the row with the item you want to add, and in the Qty. Selected column, specify the requested quantity of the item (measured in the default unit of measure shown in the UOM column). Click the Add & Close button, which closes the dialog box. In the Operation column of the added table row, make sure that Receipt is selected. Click Save on the form toolbar. On the Document Details tab, do the following for each row (with the Issue operation) you want to add for a replacement item: Click Add Stock Item on the table toolbar. The Inventory Lookup dialog box appears with a list of active inventory items. In the dialog box, type the inventory ID of the item in the Inventory box. Type its subitem (if subitems are used in your system) in the Subitem box. In the resulting list of items, select the unlabeled check box in the row with the item, and in the Qty. Selected column, specify the quantity of the replacement item. Click the Add & Close button, which closes the dialog box. Click Save on the form toolbar. Optional: Add a line (with the Issue operation) for a refund as follows: In the Inventory box, select the refund non-stock item. Optional: In the Quantity column, specify the quantity of the item. In the Extended Price column, type the refund amount. Click the Add & Close button, which closes the dialog box. Click Save on the form toolbar. Clear the Hold check box in the Summary area of the form. Click Save on the form toolbar. When you create an order of the RM type, make sure that for each line with the Receipt transaction type, the order has a line with Issue as the transaction type for a replacement item. You can add these lines manually (at this point, you can select other items for replacement), or you can select the Auto-Create Issue check box for each Receipt -type line (for items that are not tracked by serial or lot numbers) to make the system add the lines of the Issue type automatically.

To Process a Merchandise Authorization Return Order (RM) On the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form, you can process an authorized return with additional charges. The processing of an authorized return order includes two subprocedures, processing the receipt of returned items and processing the shipment of replacement items, that can be performed in any order. Both of these subprocedures are provided in this topic. To open any form, you can navigate to it or search for it (by its name or by its form ID without periods). For more information about search capabilities, see Search in the Modern UI. To Process the Receipt of Returned Items Open the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form by searching for or navigating to it. In the Summary area, select the order by its type ( RM ) and reference number. On the form toolbar, click Actions Create Receipt to create a shipment (with the Receipt operation) that accounts for the returned goods. The system opens the ([~/?ScreenId=SO302000|SO302000]) Shipments (SO302000) form to display the new shipment with the Receipt operation selected in the Summary area. On the opened form, review the shipment details, clear the Hold check box in the Summary area, and click Save on the form toolbar. Click Actions Confirm Shipment . Click Actions Prepare Invoice . This generates a credit memo with the returned items listed. The system opens the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices (SO303000) form to display the new document. Optional: On the opened form, release the credit memo by clicking Actions Release on the form toolbar. This creates an issue transaction of the Credit Memo type in the Inventory module. To Process the Issue of Replacement Items Open the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form by searching for or navigating to it. In the Summary area, select the order by its type ( RM ) and reference number. On the form toolbar, click Actions Create Shipment to create a shipment (with the Issue operation) that accounts for the replacement items. The system opens the ([~/?ScreenId=SO302000|SO302000]) Shipments (SO302000) form to display the new shipment with the Issue operation specified in the Summary area. Optional: On the form toolbar of this form, to print a pick list for the selected replacement items, click Actions Print Pick List . On the form toolbar, click Actions Confirm Shipment . Click Actions Prepare Invoice to generate an Accounts Receivable invoice with the Balanced status. The system assigns the original RM order the Invoiced status.

Reserving Payments for Sales Orders Many businesses perform sales on credit: A customer order is paid after the order has been shipped and an invoice for the shipped goods and services has been sent to the customer. In some cases, businesses may require prepayments or payments to be made for particular orders, or your organization can charge a customer card for specific orders. If you rely on payment auto-application, payments are applied to unrelated invoices starting from the earliest documents, and it is difficult to perform reconciliation of balances later. With Acumatica ERP, you can create payments and prepayments directly on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form, thus reserving these payments or prepayments for the particular order in full or partially. Also, you can link an order to existing prepayments or payments by their reference numbers. There may be many variations of processing a sales order with reserved payment, such as multiple shipments and multiple invoices for the order, multiple payments reserved for one order, or multiple orders paid by one prepayment. If the order is being shipped in multiple shipments, you can track how the payment's partial amounts was applied to multiple invoices. Linking Orders and Payments When you enter a new sales order on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form, you can create a payment or prepayment directly from the Payments tab by clicking Create Payment or Create Prepayment on the table toolbar. The system brings up the ([~/?ScreenId=AR302000|AR302000]) Payments and Applications (AR302000) form in a pop-up window. After you enter and save the payment or prepayment, it is linked to the sales order and can be reviewed on the Payments tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Ordersform. When you enter a new customer prepayment or payment on the ([~/?ScreenId=AR302000|AR302000]) Payments and Applications form, you can link it directly to a particular order or multiple by adding the order or orders on the Orders to Apply tab. Payments with balances that have been partially applied to invoices (whether or not the invoices are related to the order) can also be reserved for sales orders. For customers who pay by using credit cards, you can create a payment, link it to particular sales order or orders, and charge the credit card by using the same form, ([~/?ScreenId=AR302000|AR302000]) Payments and Applications. Applying Parent and Child Payments If the Parent-Child Customer Relationship feature has been enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form, you can configure parent-child relationships between customer accounts. If the Consolidate Balance check box is selected for a child account on the Billing Settings tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=AR303000|AR303000]) Customers (AR303000) form, you can apply parent payments and prepayments to the open sales orders of this child account. When the invoice is prepared for the sales order, the payment application amount is transferred to the invoice. If you enter an invoice for a child customer directly on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices (SO303000) form, you can also apply payments and prepayments of the parent customer to this invoice. For more information on the configuration of parent-child relationships, see Managing Parent-Child Relationships. Processing Orders with Reserved Payments An order with a payment linked is processed in the same way as any other order is. Once an order with linked payments or prepayments is shipped, the payment or prepayment amount applied to an order is transferred to the Sales Orders invoice or invoices generated for the order. On release of the SO invoices, the system applies the payment amounts reserved for the order to the invoices. If the amount of payments is equal to the order total, the invoices are closed. If the total amount of payments or prepayments applied to the order is less than the order total, the system leaves one of the invoices open with the unpaid balance (which is the difference between the order total and the payments' total). You can view the history of application on the Application History tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=AR302000|AR302000]) Payments and Applications (AR302000) form. As orders linked to this payment are shipped and completed, you will see on the Application History tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=AR302000|AR302000]) Payments and Applications form the list of applied invoices (generated for those orders) as it is populated. When a full-amount payment has been reserved for an order, once the order has been shipped and an invoice has been generated and released, the payment amount is applied to the invoice; the invoice is assigned the Closed status on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices (SO303000) form, while the order is assigned the Completed status on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form. If an order with a full-amount payment is shipped partially and then is completed or canceled, the amount applied to the order is reset to zero, while the payment with an unapplied balance is assigned the Open status and its applied amount is transferred to the invoice. Limitations on Payment Application The application of payments to sales orders has the following limitations: Payments and prepayments can be applied to only sales orders with single-installment credit terms specified in the Terms box on the Financial Settings tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form. If you change single-installment credit terms to multiple-installment terms for an existing sales order with payments or prepayments applied, these applications will be unlinked from the sales order. For more information on configuring credit terms, see Setup of Credit Terms. If approval of sales orders is required in your organization, you can specify payments for only orders that have undergone the required approvals and have the Open status. For details about approval processes, see Sales Order Approval. Canceling Payment Reservation If no invoice has been generated for the order, you can cancel payment application by removing the reserved payment from the list on the Payments tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form.

row.PlainText: Processing Purchases Acumatica ERP supports multiple types of purchase orders, and you can use various workflow options to configure the processing of orders of each type. The topics of this chapter describe how to process purchase orders and purchase receipts, and how to prepare an AP bill to the vendor for purchased goods and services. In This Chapter Purchase Process VariationsPurchase Order CreationLine Types in Purchase OrdersPurchase Receipt CreationAccounts Payable Bills with Stock ItemsAllocation of Purchase Price VarianceSupport of COD TransactionsPurchase Order Statuses

Purchase Process Variations When purchase receipts are created and released, they indicate that the purchased goods have been received at the company's warehouses and allocated. In most cases, the purchasing process is completed when goods are received, and AP bills are released to adjust your outstanding balances with the vendors. In some organizations, the AP bill is processed before the items are received. Different organizations can use different workflow for the processing of purchases. The topics of this part of the guide provide a detailed description of the workflows that you can establish in Acumatica ERP for processing purchases. In This Part Purchase with Receipt Before BillingPurchase with Billing Before ReceiptPurchase with Direct Purchase Receipt

row.column: Purchase with Receipt Before Billing To process a purchase of items in Acumatica ERP, you create and process purchase orders of the Normal type. In Acumatica ERP, you can process purchases in which the bills are generated after the ordered goods and services have been received from the vendors. The following diagram represents the general workflow of the processing of a purchase receipt before the bill is generated. The remaining sections of this topic describe in detail the processing steps shown in the diagram. 1. Enter the Purchase Order You create a new purchase order of the Normal type on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders (PO301000) form. On the purchase order, you can list the stock and non-stock items to be purchased from the particular vendor. The reference number for a new purchase order is generated in accordance with the numbering sequence specified on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO101000|PO101000]) Purchase Orders Preferences (PO101000) form. If the order is initially created with the On Hold status, you should clear the Hold check box when you are ready to process the order further. For details about the settings specified in the purchase order, see Purchase Order Creation. 2. Prepare the Purchase Receipt While you are viewing the purchase order on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders (PO301000) form, you can create a purchase receipt for the purchase order by clicking Actions > Enter PO Receipt on the form toolbar. The system navigates to the ([~/?ScreenId=PO302000|PO302000]) Purchase Receipts (PO302000) form with the prepared purchase receipt. The reference number for the new purchase receipt is generated in accordance with the numbering sequence specified on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO101000|PO101000]) Purchase Orders Preferences (PO101000) form. If the purchase receipt is initially created with the On Hold status, you should clear the Hold check box when you are ready to process the receipt further. As an alternate way to prepare the purchase receipt, you can create a new purchase receipt of the Receipt type manually on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO302000|PO302000]) Purchase Receipts form and add the lines of the purchase order (or of multiple purchase orders with the same vendor) to the purchase receipt. 3. Release the Purchase Receipt To release the prepared purchase receipt, while you are viewing it on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO302000|PO302000]) Purchase Receipts (PO302000) form, you click Release on the form toolbar. Alternatively, you can release multiple purchase receipts at the same time by using the ([~/?ScreenId=PO501000|PO501000]) Release Purchase Receipts (PO501000) form. When the purchase receipt is released, the system automatically generates a corresponding inventory receipt, with the date and posting period of the purchase receipt, to add the received items to inventory. You can review the generated inventory receipt on the ([~/?ScreenId=IN301000|IN301000]) Receipts (IN301000) form. After all the lines in the purchase order have been received in full, the purchase order is assigned the Completed status. 3. Prepare and Release the Accounts Payable Bill If the Create Bill check box is selected for the purchase receipt on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO302000|PO302000]) Purchase Receipts (PO302000) form, when you release the purchase receipt, the system generates an accounts payable bill to the vendor automatically. Otherwise, you need to prepare the bill manually from the related purchase receipt by clicking Actions > Enter AP Bill on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=PO302000|PO302000]) Purchase Receipts form. You can view the generated AP bill on the ([~/?ScreenId=AP301000|AP301000]) Bills and Adjustments (AP301000) form. Alternatively, you can create a new AP bill manually on the ([~/?ScreenId=AP301000|AP301000]) Bills and Adjustments form and add or link the lines of the purchase orders (for non-stock items that do not require purchase receipts) or purchase receipts (for stock items and non-stock items requiring receipt) to the bill. For more information on the processing of Accounts Payable bills, see Processing Bills and Adjustments. To be able to link the lines of a bill to the lines of the corresponding purchase orders and purchase receipts, make sure that for the bill, the Tax Settings option is selected in the Tax Calculation Mode box on the Financial Details tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=AP301000|AP301000]) Bills and Adjustments form. If all the lines in the purchase order have been billed in full, the purchase order is assigned the Closed status. For more information on the rules that affect line closing and completion, see the topics of the Line Types in Purchase Orders section. 4. Release the Inventory Receipt The generated inventory receipt is released automatically if the Release IN Documents Automatically check box is selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO101000|PO101000]) Purchase Orders Preferences (PO101000) form. If this check box is cleared, you have to release the inventory receipt manually by clicking Release on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=IN301000|IN301000]) Receipts (IN301000) form. On release of the inventory receipt, a batch of GL transactions is generated.

Purchase with Billing Before Receipt In your organization, if bills are received from vendors and entered into the system before the goods arrive or if bills are imported from a third-party system, you can establish a workflow in which the accounts payable bill can be processed before the ordered items have been received. You can create an AP bill before purchase receipt if the Allow AP Bill Before Receipt check box is selected for the applicable purchase order on the Other Information tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders form. The state of this check box is copied from the settings of the specified vendor on the ([~/?ScreenId=AP303000|AP303000]) Vendors (AP303000) form or from the settings of the particular vendor location on the ([~/?ScreenId=AP303010|AP303010]) Vendor Locations (AP303010) form. For the purchase orders that have the Allow AP Bill Before Receipt check box selected, you can process the AP bill and purchase receipt in any order. This topic describes the workflow with processing a bill before the related purchase receipt. For a description of the workflow with processing a receipt before the related bill, see Purchase with Receipt Before Billing. The following diagram represents the general workflow of the processing when billing occurs before the purchase receipt. The remaining sections of this topic describe in detail the processing steps shown in the diagram. 1. Enter the Purchase Order You create a new purchase order of the Normal type on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders (PO301000) form. On the purchase order, you can list the stock and non-stock items to be purchased from the particular vendor. The reference number for a new purchase order is generated in accordance with the numbering sequence specified on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO101000|PO101000]) Purchase Orders Preferences (PO101000) form. If the order is initially created with the On Hold status, you should clear the Hold check box when you are ready to process the order further. For details about the settings specified in the purchase order, see Purchase Order Creation. 2. Prepare and Release the Accounts Payable Bill You prepare the accounts payable bill from a purchase order you are viewing on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders (PO301000) form by clicking Actions > Enter AP Bill on the form toolbar. You can view the generated AP bill on the ([~/?ScreenId=AP301000|AP301000]) Bills and Adjustments (AP301000) form. Alternatively, you can create a new AP bill manually on the ([~/?ScreenId=AP301000|AP301000]) Bills and Adjustments form and add the lines of the purchase order to the bill by clicking Add PO on the table toolbar of the Document Details tab; you then select the needed purchase order in the dialog box that opens. For more information, see Accounts Payable Bills with Stock Items. You can release the generated bill at any moment, before or after the processing of the receipt of the ordered items. For more information on the processing of AP bills, see Processing Bills and Adjustments. 3. Prepare the Purchase Receipt While you are viewing a purchase order on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders (PO301000) form, you create the corresponding purchase receipt by clicking Actions > Enter PO Receipt on the form toolbar. The system navigates to the prepared purchase receipt on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO302000|PO302000]) Purchase Receipts (PO302000) form. The reference number for the new purchase receipt is generated in accordances with the numbering sequence specified on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO101000|PO101000]) Purchase Orders Preferences (PO101000) form. If the purchase receipt is initially created with the On Hold status, you should clear the Hold check box when you are ready to process the purchase receipt further. As an alternate way to prepare the purchase receipt, you can create a new purchase receipt of the Receipt type manually on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO302000|PO302000]) Purchase Receipts form and add the lines of the purchase order (or of multiple purchase orders with the same vendor) to the purchase receipt. If all the lines in the purchase order have been received and billed in full, the purchase order is assigned the Closed status. For more information on the rules that affect line closing and completion, see the topics of the Line Types in Purchase Orders section. 4. Release the Purchase Receipt Because the AP bill has been already prepared, clear the Create Bill check box in the purchase receipt (if it was selected by default) before you release the purchase receipt. To release the prepared purchase receipt, while you are viewing it on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO302000|PO302000]) Purchase Receipts (PO302000) form, you click Release on the form toolbar. Alternatively, you can release multiple purchase receipts at the same time by using the ([~/?ScreenId=PO501000|PO501000]) Release Purchase Receipts (PO501000) form. When the purchase receipt is released, the system automatically generates a corresponding inventory receipt with the date and posting period of the purchase receipt to add the received items to inventory. You can view the generated inventory receipt on the ([~/?ScreenId=IN301000|IN301000]) Receipts (IN301000) form. 5. Release the Inventory Receipt The generated inventory receipt is released automatically if the Release IN Documents Automatically check box is selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO101000|PO101000]) Purchase Orders Preferences (PO101000) form. If this check box is cleared, you have to release the inventory receipt manually by clicking Release on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=IN301000|IN301000]) Receipts (IN301000) form. On release of the inventory receipt, a batch of GL transactions is generated.

Purchase with Direct Purchase Receipt In Acumatica ERP, you can process direct purchase receipts that does not have corresponding purchase orders. The following diagram represents the general workflow of the processing of a direct purchase receipt. The remaining sections of this topic describe in detail the processing steps shown in the diagram. 1. Enter the Purchase Receipt You create a new purchase receipt on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO302000|PO302000]) Purchase Receipts (PO302000) form and assign it the Receipt type. On the purchase receipt, you can list the stock and non-stock items to be received from the particular vendor. The reference number for a new purchase receipt is generated in accordance with the numbering sequence specified on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO101000|PO101000]) Purchase Orders Preferences (PO101000) form. If the purchase receipt is created with the On Hold status, you should clear the Hold check box when you are ready to process the receipt further. 2. Release the Purchase Receipt To release the purchase receipt, while you are viewing it on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO302000|PO302000]) Purchase Receipts (PO302000) form, you click Release on the form toolbar. Alternatively, you can release multiple purchase receipts at the same time by using the ([~/?ScreenId=PO501000|PO501000]) Release Purchase Receipts (PO501000) form. When the purchase receipt is released, the system automatically generates a corresponding inventory receipt, with the date and posting period of the purchase receipt, to add the received items to inventory. You can review the generated inventory receipt on the ([~/?ScreenId=IN301000|IN301000]) Receipts (IN301000) form. 3. Prepare the Accounts Payable Bill If the Create Bill check box is selected for the purchase receipt on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO302000|PO302000]) Purchase Receipts (PO302000) form, when you release the purchase receipt, the system generates an accounts payable bill to the vendor automatically. Otherwise, you need to prepare the bill manually from the related purchase receipt on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO302000|PO302000]) Purchase Receipts form by clicking Actions > Enter AP Bill on the form toolbar. You can view the generated AP bill on the ([~/?ScreenId=AP301000|AP301000]) Bills and Adjustments (AP301000) form. For more information on the processing of AP bills, see Processing Bills and Adjustments. 4. Release the Inventory Receipt The generated inventory receipt is released automatically if the Release IN Documents Automatically check box is selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO101000|PO101000]) Purchase Orders Preferences (PO101000) form. If this check box is cleared, you have to release the inventory receipt manually by clicking Release on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=IN301000|IN301000]) Receipts (IN301000) form. On release of the inventory receipt, a batch of GL transactions is generated. You can release the receipt before or after preparing the AP bill.

Purchase Order Creation The purchase process typically starts with an employee entering a purchase order. This topic describes how you create a purchase order, which settings could affect the purchase order processing, which lines could be added to the order, and how to track unbilled quantities and amounts in the order. Creating a Purchase Order In general, the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders (PO301000) form is the starting point for creating a purchase order, and employees can use this form to track the processing of the order. In Acumatica ERP, for processing most purchases, purchase orders of the Normal type are used. When you are creating a new order, you should first select a vendor and the vendor location. A newly created purchase order has the On Hold status. To reduce input errors on order entry, you can set up the validation of order totals by selecting the For Normal and Standard Orders check box in the Validate Total on Entry section of the ([~/?ScreenId=PO101000|PO101000]) Purchase Orders Preferences (PO101000) form. If this check box is selected, then when you create a new purchase order on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders (PO301000) form, to take the order off hold, you must enter the order total in the Control Total box after verifying the order details. For more information on how you can set up document processing, see Changing the Processing of Purchase Documents. Purchase orders based on requisitions, customer drop-ship orders, customer orders marked for purchasing, and replenishment requests can be created in bulk on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO505000|PO505000]) Create Purchase Orders (PO505000) form. Adding Lines to a Purchase Order In a purchase order created on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders (PO301000) form, you list the stock and non-stock items to be purchased from the particular vendor. Purchase orders can include multiple lines of different line types. You can add stock items by clicking the Add Item button on the table toolbar of the Document Details tab and selecting from only the vendor's items or from the entire list of stock items. If you want to add non-stock items of any type ( Labor , Service , Non-Stock , or Expense ), you can add a line and select a non-stock item by its inventory ID. The system processes different line types in different ways, which are described in detail in the following topics: Stock Item Lines in Purchase OrdersNon-Stock Lines in Purchase OrdersService Lines in Purchase OrdersIf a purchase order includes stock and non-stock items of various types, its processing includes the creation of a receipt or multiple receipts. Then you can create separate bills: one based on receipts linked to the order, and another based on those lines of the original purchase order whose line items do not require receipt. Alternatively, you can create a single bill for all purchase order lines, both stock and non-stock by manually adding the items not requiring receipt to a bill prepared based on a receipt. If the Blanket and Standard Purchase Orders feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form, you can also add a blanket purchase order or a line of a blanket purchase order to a purchase order. Approving a Purchase Order If the approval of purchase orders is configured in your system, the order is given the Pending Approval status once you take it off hold; the status will change to Pending Printing , Pending Email , or Open once all the assigned approvers approve it. For details on approval, see Purchase Order Approval. If the approval of purchase orders is not configured, a purchase order may need to be emailed or printed once you take it off hold. After that, the order is given the Open status and can be processed. Variations in Processing a Purchase Order The general workflow of processing a purchase order with lines of any type is to process a purchase receipt (if one is needed) before creating an AP bill. However, if you receive bills from a particular vendor before the ordered items are received to inventory, you can configure this vendor so that for the purchase orders of this vendor, you can create and process an AP bill even before the purchase receipt is created for the purchase order. The order in which you create and process documents related to a purchase order depends on the state of the Allow AP Bill Before Receipt check box specified for a purchase order on the Other Information tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders (PO301000) form. The state of this check box is copied from the vendor settings on the ([~/?ScreenId=AP303000|AP303000]) Vendors (AP303000) form, or from the vendor location settings on the ([~/?ScreenId=AP303010|AP303010]) Vendor Locations (AP303010) form. The setting affects the processing of purchase orders in the following way: If the check box is cleared, the AP bill can be created for a purchase order only after the related purchase receipt has been released. You can add to the created bill only unbilled lines of the released purchase receipts (for stock items and non-stock items requiring receipt) and unbilled purchase order lines (for non-stock items that do not require receipt). If the check box is selected, the AP bill and purchase receipt can be prepared in any order. If the AP bill is prepared first, you can add to it unbilled lines of a purchase order that have not yet been included in any other bill. For a detailed description of processing steps in these workflows, see the following topics: Purchase with Receipt Before BillingPurchase with Billing Before Receipt ([~/?ScreenId=PO101000|PO101000])

To Create a Purchase Order To begin processing a purchase of stock or non-stock items, you create a purchase order on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders (PO301000) form. To open any form, you can navigate to it or search for it (by its name or by its form ID without periods). For more information about search capabilities, see Search in the Modern UI. To Create a Purchase Order Open the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders (PO301000) form by searching for or navigating to it. In the Summary area, select Normal as the purchase order type. Select the vendor. Check the location of the vendor, and change it if needed. Optional: In the Currency box, check the currency and the currency exchange rate; change these, if needed. Check the date of the purchase order, and change it if needed. Optional: In the Vendor Ref. box, specify the reference number of the vendor's original document. (This value may be required, based on your organization's settings.) Specify a brief description of the purchase order. On the Document Details tab, perform the following steps to add one item or multiple stock items to the purchase order: Click Add Item on the table toolbar. The Inventory Lookup dialog box appears with the list of active stock items. You can use the selection criteria at the top of the dialog box to narrow the list of items. In the line or lines with the items that you want to add, in the Qty. Selected column, specify the quantity of the items to be purchased (measured in the unit of measure shown in the Purchase Unit column). Click Add & Close at the bottom of the dialog box. On the Document Details tab, review the information in the added line or lines, and correct it, if needed. Optional: Add non-stock and service lines by adding new rows on the Document Details tab, selecting the items' IDs, and specifying the ordered quantity in the Order Qty. column. Optional: If the Control Total box appears in the Summary area of the form, type the total amount of the purchase order. Clear the Hold check box in the Summary area. Click Save on the form toolbar.

row.PlainText: Line Types in Purchase Orders Purchase orders in Acumatica ERP can include multiple lines of different line types; the type a particular line has depends on the settings of the item specified in the line. The line type indicates how the system processes this purchase order line. The topics of this part describes the line types, the settings you can configure to affect the purchase workflow for these types of lines, and the line completion rules for each line type. In This Part Stock Item Lines in Purchase OrdersNon-Stock Lines in Purchase OrdersService Lines in Purchase Orders

row.column: Stock Item Lines in Purchase Orders When you add a stock item to a purchase order on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders (PO301000) form, the system inserts Goods for IN as the line type for this line. If a purchase order includes only stock items that are intended for inventory and not linked to a drop-ship order or any other sales order, its processing involves the creation of a purchase receipt (or multiple receipts if the order is fulfilled by multiple shipments from the vendor) and the preparation of an accounts payable bill. You can configure a particular vendor so that the AP bill for a purchase order can be created before the purchase receipt is processed. This topic describes how the system processes stock lines added to a purchase order. Processing of the Purchase Receipt for the Purchase Order You can create a receipt for a purchase order by clicking Actions Enter PO Receipt on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders (PO301000) form. Alternatively, on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO302000|PO302000]) Purchase Receipts (PO302000) form, you can create a receipt and link it to an existing purchase order or a particular line of the order by clicking Add PO or Add PO Line on the table toolbar of the Document Details tab. You can also allocate the lines with the Goods for IN line type by clicking Allocations on the table toolbar of the Document Details tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=PO302000|PO302000]) Purchase Receipts (PO302000) form. The inventory account that is used for a stock item on a receipt by default is selected according to the Use Inventory/Accrual Account from setting of the posting class. On release of each purchase receipt linked to the purchase order, the system automatically generates an inventory receipt for the items listed in the purchase receipt and calculates the quantities of the received goods for each order line. These values are displayed in the Qty. On Receipts column on the Document Details tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders form. For each purchase receipt, you can create an AP bill or multiple bills. Processing of the Accounts Payable Bill for the Purchase Order The general workflow of processing purchase orders with lines of any type is to process a purchase receipt (if one is needed) before creating an AP bill (see Purchase with Receipt Before Billing for details). However, if you receive bills from a particular vendor before the ordered items are received to inventory, you can configure this vendor so that for the purchase orders of this vendor, you can create and process an AP bill before the purchase receipt is released. To do this, you need to select the Allow AP Bill Before Receipt check box in the vendor settings on the ([~/?ScreenId=AP303000|AP303000]) Vendors (AP303000) form; in addition, you can select this check box for a particular vendor location on the ([~/?ScreenId=AP303010|AP303010]) Vendor Locations (AP303010) form. The state of this check box is copied to each purchase order created for this vendor, and can be reviewed on the Other Information tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders (PO301000) form. For a detailed description on how to process a purchase order with the associated bill being prepared before the receipt, see Purchase with Billing Before Receipt. Rules for Closing and Completing Goods for IN Lines A Goods for IN line of a purchase order is considered closed on release of the purchase receipt or AP bill if the sum of the received quantity for all released purchase receipts prepared for this line is equal to the line quantity in all released AP bills prepared for this line, and the quantity in the AP bill lines is equal to or greater than purchase order line quantity * ( Complete On % /100). The line is also considered closed on release of the purchase receipt or AP bill if the sum of the received quantity for all released purchase receipts prepared for this line is equal to the line quantity in all released AP bills prepared for this line, and the user has selected the Completed check box manually. A Goods for IN line of a purchase order is completed in any of the following cases: Automatically if the system has closed the line (that is, if the Closed check box is selected) On release of the purchase receipt prepared for the line if the user has selected the Completed check box manually If the sum of the received quantity for all released purchase receipts prepared for this line is equal to or greater than the quantity of the purchase order line * ( Complete On % /100) If a user processes the lines of a purchase order partially, multiple related purchase receipts and AP bills can be prepared for a single purchase order. The system determines which purchase order lines should be added to the prepared purchase receipt or AP bill depending on the status of the Completed and Closed check boxes in each line, as follows: Completed purchase order lines are not added to the purchase receipt. Closed lines are added to neither purchase receipts, nor to AP bills. If all purchase order lines have the Completed check box selected, and at least one line still has the Closed check box cleared, the purchase order is assigned the Completed status. If all purchase order lines have the Completed and Closed check boxes selected, the purchase order is assigned the Closed status.

Non-Stock Lines in Purchase Orders For each non-stock item, you define whether a purchase receipt is required by selecting or clearing the Require Receipt check box on the General Settings tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=IN202000|IN202000]) Non-Stock Items (IN202000) form. This setting affects the processing of non-stock items that are included in purchase orders. In a purchase order line on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders (PO301000) form, when you select a non-stock item that requires a receipt, the system inserts Non-Stock as the line type. Processing a purchase order with Non-Stock lines always involves creating a receipt (or multiple receipts if the ordered items are not delivered at the same time). When you create a purchase receipt for a purchase order, the system copies all Non-Stock lines to the purchase receipt. This topic describes how the system processes purchase order lines for non-stock items requiring receipt. Processing of the Accounts Payable Bill for the Purchase Order The general workflow of processing purchase orders with lines of any type is to process the associated purchase receipt (if one is needed) before the creation of the associated AP bill (see Purchase with Receipt Before Billing for details). However, if you receive bills from a particular vendor before the purchased items are received to inventory, you can configure this vendor so that for its purchase orders, you can create and process an AP bill before the purchase receipt is released. To do this, you need to select the Allow AP Bill Before Receipt check box in the vendor settings on the ([~/?ScreenId=AP303000|AP303000]) Vendors (AP303000) form; in addition, you can select this check box for a particular vendor location on the ([~/?ScreenId=AP303010|AP303010]) Vendor Locations (AP303010) form. The state of this check box will be copied to each purchase order created to this vendor, and can be reviewed on the Other Information tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders (PO301000) form. For a detailed description on how to process a purchase order with the associated bill being prepared before the receipt, see Purchase with Billing Before Receipt. Posting Accounts for Non-Stock Lines For the Non-Stock lines on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders form, in the Account column, the system inserts the Expense account defined by the Use COGS / Expense Account From setting of the posting class specified on the ([~/?ScreenId=IN206000|IN206000]) Posting Classes (IN206000) form. If the Subaccounts feature is enabled in your system, the system also inserts the subaccount, which is composed as defined by the Combine COGS / Expense Sub From setting of the ([~/?ScreenId=IN206000|IN206000]) Posting Classes (IN206000) form, in the Sub. column of the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders form. Accounts and subaccounts are used for processing Non-Stock lines as follows: When a purchase order is created, the item amount is recorded to the Expense account (with the Expense subaccount). When a purchase receipt linked to the purchase order is released, the line amount is moved from the Expense account (with the Expense subaccount) to the PO Accrual account (with the PO Accrual subaccount). When a bill is created for the receipt, the amount is moved back from the PO Accrual account (with the PO Accrual subaccount) to the Expense account (with the Expense subaccount). The Expense and PO Accrual accounts to be used for receipt-related transactions are defined by the posting class of the item on the ([~/?ScreenId=IN206000|IN206000]) Posting Classes (IN206000) form; the default accounts assigned to the item on the GL Accounts tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=IN202000|IN202000]) Non-Stock Items form will be used if the posting class's Use COGS / Expense Account From and Use PO Accrual Account From settings have the Inventory Item option selected. The Expense subaccount and PO Accrual subaccount are also defined by the settings of posting class of the item; the default subaccounts assigned to the item on the GL Accounts tab will be used as the segment value sources for the resulting subaccounts based on the Combine COGS / Expense Sub From and Combine PO Accrual Sub From rules. For more information, see Posting Classes in Inventory. Rules for Closing and Completing Non-Stock Lines The way the lines of the Non-Stock type are completed and closed depends on the completion rule specified for the applicable non-stock item in the Complete PO Line box on the ([~/?ScreenId=IN202000|IN202000]) Non-Stock Items (IN202000) form. The system determines if a line of the Non-Stock type should be closed and completed by using the following rules: If By Quantity is selected in the Complete PO Line box for the item (the default option for non-stock items of the Non-Stock Item type), the purchase order line is considered completed in either of the following cases: If the sum of the received quantity for the released purchase receipts prepared for the line is equal to or greater than the quantity of the purchase order line * ( Complete On % /100) On release of the purchase receipt prepared for the line if the user has selected the Completed check box manually With the By Quantity completion rule selected for the item, the line is considered closed on release of the purchase receipt or AP bill if the sum of the received quantity for all released purchase receipts prepared for this line is equal to the line quantity in all released AP bills prepared for this line, and the quantity in the AP bill lines is equal to or greater than purchase order line quantity * ( Complete On % /100). The line is also considered closed on release of the purchase receipt or AP bill if the sum of the received quantity for all released purchase receipts prepared for this line is equal to the line quantity in all released AP bills prepared for this line, and the user has selected the Completed check box manually in the purchase receipt line. If By Amount is selected in the Complete PO Line box for the item (the default option for non-stock items of the Labor, Service, Charge , and Expense types), the purchase order line is considered completed in either of the following cases: Automatically if the system has closed the line (that is, if the Closed check box is selected) On release of the purchase receipt prepared for the line if the user has selected the Completed check box manually With the By Quantity completion rule selected for the item, the line is considered closed on release of the purchase receipt or AP bill if the sum of received quantity for all released purchase receipts prepared for this line is equal to the quantity in all released AP bills prepared for this line, and if the amount in the AP bill lines is equal to or greater than the amount of the purchase order line. If a user processes the lines of a purchase order partially, multiple related purchase receipts and AP bills can be prepared for a single purchase order. The system determines which purchase order lines should be added to the prepared purchase receipt or AP bill depending on the status of the Completed and Closed check boxes in each line, as follows: Completed purchase order lines are not added to the purchase receipt. Closed lines are added to neither purchase receipts nor AP bills. If all purchase order lines have the Completed check box selected, and at least one line still has the Closed check box cleared, the purchase order is assigned the Completed status. If all purchase order lines have the Completed and Closed check boxes selected, the purchase order is assigned the Closed status.

Service Lines in Purchase Orders For each non-stock item, you define whether a purchase receipt is required by selecting or clearing the Require Receipt check box on the General Settings tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=IN202000|IN202000]) Non-Stock Items (IN202000) form. In a purchase order line on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders (PO301000) form, when you select a non-stock item that does not require receipt, the system inserts Service as the line type; also, the system inserts the Service line type in purchase order lines with no item specified. Although the Service lines are not tracked in inventory and do not require receipt, if you want to list them in purchase receipts for informational purposes, you can configure the system so that these lines are added to purchase receipts. This topic describes how the system processes Service lines added to a purchase order, and explains how the lines with these items are completed. General Workflow and Related Documents The following diagram illustrates how the Service lines in purchase orders can be processed depending on the system settings. The remainder of this topic describes in detail the processing steps shown in the diagram and issues related to how this processing unfolds. The processing of the service order consists of the following steps: Entering a purchase order You enter a purchase order of the Normal type on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders (PO301000) form, and you add a Service line or multiple lines to the order. The reference number for a new purchase order is generated in accordance with the numbering sequence specified on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO101000|PO101000]) Purchase Orders Preferences (PO101000) form. If the order is created with the On Hold status, you should clear the Hold check box for the order to process it further. For details about the settings specified in the purchase order, see Purchase Order Creation. Conditionally processing Service lines The way the system processes Service lines depends on the state of the Process Service Lines from Normal Purchase Orders via Purchase Receipt check box on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO101000|PO101000]) Purchase Orders Preferences (IN101000) form. If the check box is cleared (the default setting), processing Service lines doesn't involve creating a purchase receipt; an AP bill (or multiple bills) has to be created directly from the purchase order (see Step 4). When a user creates a purchase receipt for a purchase order with lines of different types, some of which require receipt and some of which do not require receipt, the system does not copy Service lines to a purchase receipt that is prepared from this purchase order. Also, in this case, Service lines cannot be added to the purchase receipt manually. Preparing a purchase receipt (optional) If the Process Service Lines from Normal Purchase Orders via Purchase Receipt check box is selected, a purchase receipt is required for the lines of the Service type. A user creates a purchase receipt from a purchase order by clicking Actions > Enter PO Receipt on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders form. The prepared purchase receipt is available for reviewing on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO302000|PO302000]) Purchase Receipts (PO302000) form. If the purchase receipt is created with the On Hold status, you should clear the Hold check box for the receipt to process it further. As an alternative to creating the purchase receipt while viewing the purchase order, a user can create a new purchase receipt manually and add Service lines to it by clicking Add PO or Add PO Line on the table toolbar of the Document Details tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=PO302000|PO302000]) Purchase Receipts form and using the dialog box that opens. Preparing an AP bill You prepare the AP bill by clicking Actions > Enter AP Bill on the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders form. The system brings up the generated AP bill on the ([~/?ScreenId=AP301000|AP301000]) Bills and Adjustments (AP301000) form. Processing of the Accounts Payable Bill for the Purchase Order The general workflow of processing purchase orders with lines of any type is to process a purchase receipt (if it is needed) before creating an AP bill (see Purchase with Receipt Before Billing for details). However, if you receive bills from a particular vendor before the ordered items are received to inventory, you can configure this vendor so that for the purchase orders of this vendor, you can create and process an AP bill before the purchase receipt is released. To do this, you need to select the Allow AP Bill Before Receipt check box in the vendor settings on the ([~/?ScreenId=AP303000|AP303000]) Vendors (AP303000) form; in addition, you can select this check box for a particular vendor location on the ([~/?ScreenId=AP303010|AP303010]) Vendor Locations (AP303010) form. The state of this check box is copied to each purchase order created for this vendor, and can be reviewed on the Other Information tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders (PO301000) form. For a detailed description on how to process a purchase order with the associated bill being prepared before the receipt, see Purchase with Billing Before Receipt. Posting Accounts for Service Lines When you add a Service line to a purchase order on the Document Details tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders (PO301000) form, in the Account column, the system inserts the expense account defined by the Use COGS / Expense Account setting of the posting class on the ([~/?ScreenId=IN206000|IN206000]) Posting Classes (IN206000) form. If the Subaccounts feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form, in the Sub. column of the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders form, the system inserts the subaccount composed as defined by the Combine COGS / Expense Sub From setting of the posting class on the ([~/?ScreenId=IN206000|IN206000]) Posting Classes (IN206000) form. Rules for Closing and Completing Service Lines The way the lines of the Service type (including the Service lines with the Inventory ID column empty) are completed and closed depends on whether the service lines are processed through receipts, and on the completion rule specified for each non-stock item in the Complete PO Line box on the ([~/?ScreenId=IN202000|IN202000]) Non-Stock Items (IN202000) form. If you change the Complete PO Line setting for a non-stock item on the ([~/?ScreenId=IN202000|IN202000]) Non-Stock Items form, the system does not change this setting for already existing purchase orders; the newly specified setting applies to new purchase orders only. Existing purchase orders will be billed with the settings that were specified when the order was entered. The system determines if a line of the Service type should be closed and completed by using the following rules: If the Service line is processed through a receipt and By Amount is selected in the Complete PO Line box for an item, the line is completed automatically when the line is closed or on release of the purchase receipt if the user has selected the Completed check box manually. The line is closed in either of the following cases: When a purchase receipt for the line is released if a user has selected the Complete PO Line check box manually in the purchase receipt line on the Document Details tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=PO302000|PO302000]) Purchase Receipts (PO302000) form. When an AP bill for the line is released if the billed quantity for all bills that have been released for this line is equal to or greater than the amount of the purchase order line. If the Service line is processed through a receipt and By Quantity is selected in the Complete PO Line box for an item, the line is closed when an AP bill for the line is released if the sum of the line quantities in all released bills for this line is equal to or greater than the quantity of the purchase order line * ( Complete On % /100). The line is completed in the following cases: Automatically if the system has closed the line (that is, if the Closed check box is selected) On release of the purchase receipt prepared for the line if the user has selected the Completed check box manually If the sum of the received quantity for the released purchase receipts prepared for the line is equal to or greater than the quantity of the purchase order line * ( Complete On % /100) If the Service line is processed without a receipt and By Amount is selected in the Complete PO Line box for the line item, the line is closed on release of the AP bill if the billed amount for all released bills for this line is equal to or greater than the amount of the purchase order line. The line is completed automatically when it is closed. If the Service line is processed without a receipt and By Quantity is selected in the Complete PO Line box for the line item, the line is closed on release of the AP bill if the sum of the quantities in released bills for this line is equal to or greater than the quantity of the purchase order line * ( Complete On % /100). The line is completed automatically when it is closed. If a user processes the lines of a purchase order partially, multiple related purchase receipts and AP bills can be prepared for a single purchase order. The system determines which purchase order lines should be added to the prepared purchase receipt or AP bill depending on the status of the Completed and Closed check boxes in each line, as follows: Completed purchase order lines are not added to the purchase receipt. Closed lines are added to neither purchase receipts nor AP bills. If all purchase order lines have the Completed check box selected, and at least one line still has the Closed check box cleared, the purchase order is assigned the Completed status. If all purchase order lines have the Completed and Closed check boxes selected, the purchase order is assigned the Closed status.

Purchase Receipt Creation A purchase receipt is used to track the one-time receipt of goods purchased from a single vendor. The purchase receipt can be linked to a purchase order (or to multiple orders) to verify purchase order fulfillment, or the purchase receipt can be processed independently without being linked to any purchase orders. This topic describes the possible ways you can create purchase receipts. For the general workflow of processing purchase receipts in Acumatica ERP, see the topics of the Purchase Order Creation section. Creating a Purchase Receipt Based on a Purchase Order If purchase orders are involved in your purchasing workflow, you can create a purchase receipt for the goods or services received for this particular purchase order by clicking Actions Enter PO Receipt on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders (PO301000) form. The system opens the created purchase receipt on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO302000|PO302000]) Purchase Receipts (PO302000) form, where you can review it. The lines that appear in a purchase receipt based on a purchase order depend on the line type of each line and on particular system settings that affect line processing. For more details on different types of lines added to purchase receipts, see Line Types in Purchase Orders. For a detailed description on processing a purchase order and all related documents, see Purchase Order Creation. For each purchase order or purchase order line added to the purchase receipt, the system calculates the quantities of the received goods, and displays this value for each line in the Qty. On Receipts column on the Document Details tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders (PO301000) form. If all purchase order lines have been received in full, and if at least one line has not yet been billed in full, the purchase order is assigned the Completed status. For blanket purchase orders, the quantities of items in the Qty. On Receipts column are updated from the lines of the normal purchase orders linked to these blanket orders. Creating a Direct Purchase Receipt You can create a direct purchase receipt and process it without linking it to any purchase order. When goods are received, you create a new purchase receipt document on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO302000|PO302000]) Purchase Receipts (PO302000) form. On the Document Details tab, you add lines to specify the quantity and additional details of all received goods. If lot or serial numbers are tracked for the received items, they may be assigned at the time of receipt if they are configured to do so. To view the assigned lot and serial numbers of the received items, click Allocations on the table toolbar of the Document Details tab. You can allocate stock items that have the Goods for IN line type, and lot- or serial-tracked stock items that have the Goods for Drop-Ship line type and that belong to the lot/serial class for which the Required for Drop Shipments check box is selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=IN207000|IN207000]) Lot/Serial Classes (IN207000) form. For detailed instructions on creating and processing a direct purchase receipt, see Purchase with Direct Purchase Receipt. Linking Purchase Orders or Their Lines to an Existing Purchase Receipt When you receive purchases from a single vendor and create a new purchase receipt on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO302000|PO302000]) Purchase Receipts (PO302000) form, you can add an entire purchase order, multiple purchase orders, or particular purchase order lines to this receipt. The lines that can be added to a purchase receipt depend on the line types of these lines and on particular system settings. For more information about which lines are processed through purchase receipts, see the topics of the Line Types in Purchase Orders part. Purchase receipts can be linked to only normal or drop-ship purchase orders; see Types of Purchase Orders for details about these and other purchase order types. Consolidating Multiple Purchase Orders into a Single Purchase Receipt For a new purchase receipt that you have created by using the ([~/?ScreenId=PO302000|PO302000]) Purchase Receipts (PO302000) form, you can add multiple purchase orders of the same vendor. You can add an entire purchase order or individual purchase order lines. The lines that can be added to a purchase receipt depend on the line types of these lines and on particular system settings. For more information about which lines are processed through purchase receipts, see the topics of the Line Types in Purchase Orders part. Purchase receipts can be linked to only normal or drop-ship purchase orders; see Types of Purchase Orders for details about these and other purchase order types. Assigning Purchase Receipts for Processing You may need to distribute receipts among employees for processing. To enable automatic assignment of receipts based on the receipt properties, you can create an assignment map by using the ([~/?ScreenId=EP205500|EP205500]) Assignment and Approval Maps (EP205500) form and specify the map in the Receipt Assignment Map box on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO101000|PO101000]) Purchase Orders Preferences (PO101000) form. Then when a new receipt is created, it will be automatically assigned to the appropriate employee for processing. To Create a Purchase Receipt By using the ([~/?ScreenId=PO302000|PO302000]) Purchase Receipts (PO302000) form, you can create a purchase receipt and add to it lines of a particular purchase order or multiple purchase orders. To open any form, you can navigate to it or search for it (by its name or by its form ID without periods). For more information about search capabilities, see Search in the Modern UI. To Create a Purchase Receipt Open the ([~/?ScreenId=PO302000|PO302000]) Purchase Receipts (PO302000) form by searching for or navigating to it. In the Summary area, select Receipt as the receipt type. Select the vendor in the Vendor box. Check the location of the vendor, and change it if needed. Check the date of the receipt, and change it if needed. Select the Create Bill check box if you want the system to create a bill for the received items automatically on release of the purchase receipt. If you want to create a bill later, do not select the check box. In the Vendor Ref. box, specify the reference number of the vendor's original document. (This value may be required, based on your organization's settings.) If you need to add the received items by entering specific inventory IDs or by scanning barcodes, do the following for each item that you want to add: Click Add Line on the table toolbar. The Add Receipt Line dialog box opens. Enter the item's inventory ID in the Inventory ID box, or scan a barcode. If only one open purchase order includes this item, the system selects it automatically and inserts the purchase order reference number into the PO Order Nbr. box of this dialog box. If multiple open orders have this item, the Add Purchase Order Line dialog box opens (displaying the lines with this item from multiple orders), In this dialog box, select the unlabeled check box in the row of the needed purchase order line, and click Add & Close to exit the Add Purchase Order Line dialog box and update the Add Receipt Line dialog box with the line settings. Review the settings of the order line in the Add Receipt Line dialog box, and click Add & Close to add the line to the receipt. Review the added line, and change the quantity of the received items in the Receipt Qty. column, if needed. Click Save on the form toolbar. If you need to add an entire purchase order (or multiple purchase orders) to the purchase receipt (that is, all lines of the selected order or orders), do the following: On the table toolbar, click Add PO . The Add Purchase Order dialog box opens. In the table of the dialog box, select the unlabeled check boxes in the rows of the purchase orders whose lines you want to add to the purchase receipt. Click Add & Close to add the lines from the selected orders. On the Document Details tab, review the order lines, delete any lines of items that weren't received, and modify the quantities of the received items, if needed. Click Save on the form toolbar. If you need to add particular lines from a purchase order, do the following: Click Add PO Line on the table toolbar of the Document Details tab. For each line that you want to add, perform the following actions In the Order Nbr. column, select the purchase order by its reference number. In the table of the dialog box, select the unlabeled check box in the row of each line with the item to be received. Click Add & Close to add the selected lines. On the Document Details tab, review each added line, and in the Receipt Qty. column, change the quantity of the received items, if needed. Click Save on the form toolbar. Optional: Do the following for each received item that requires lot or serial numbers to be specified: On the Document Details tab, click the line with this item, and click Allocations on the table toolbar. The Allocations dialog box opens. In the Allocations dialog box, in the Location column, select the location where the units will be stocked in each allocated line; then check the value in the Start Lot/Serial Nbr. box (which is the number starting from which the lot or serial numbers will be generated), and click Generate . Click OK to save the allocations and close the dialog box. Click Save on the form toolbar. Optional: If the Control Qty. box is displayed in the Summary area of the form, type the total quantity of the items included in the receipt. Clear the Hold check box. Click Save on the form toolbar.
