Scan and Transfer Operation If the Base Inventory feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form, on the ([~/?ScreenId=IN304020|IN304020]) Scan and Transfer (IN304020) form, you can perform the automated transfer of inventory items between locations of the same warehouse or between locations of different warehouses that are assigned to the same building by using a barcode scanner or a mobile device with a scanning option. This topic describes the workflow that you can configure in Acumatica ERP for the automated transfer of inventory items. System Preparation To be able to process transfers by using the ([~/?ScreenId=IN304020|IN304020]) Scan and Transfer (IN304020) form, the system should be configured as follows: The Multiple Warehouse Locations feature has been enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form. Warehouse locations have been configured on the ([~/?ScreenId=IN204000|IN204000]) Warehouses (IN204000) form. Warehouse buildings have been assigned to warehouses in the Building ID box of the Address Information tab on the ([~/?ScreenId=IN204000|IN204000]) Warehouses form if users should have the ability to transfer items between different warehouses located in the same building. Workflow Variations Based on the settings specified on the ([~/?ScreenId=IN101000|IN101000]) Inventory Preferences (IN101000) form, the following workflow variations can be configured and used for the automated transfer of inventory items: You enter the barcodes of the origin and destination locations for each new item. You enter a reason code for each new line of an inventory transfer. You enter a quantity for all lines of the document once. For more information on configuring workflows, see Configuration of Warehouse Operation Workflows. Overview of Automated Scanning and Transferring The automated transfer of inventory items involves the steps shown in the following diagram and described below. Workflow of Automated Scanning and Transferring To transfer items (and use Scan and Transfer mode), you perform the following steps: Switch to Scan and Transfer mode . You switch to Scan and Transfer mode by scanning or entering the @intransfer barcode. The system opens the ([~/?ScreenId=IN304020|IN304020]) Scan and Transfer (IN304020) form. Scan the origin location barcode . You scan the barcode of the origin location where the item to be transferred is currently stored. Optional: Scan the origin warehouse barcode . If the location whose identifier you scanned in the previous step is assigned to multiple warehouses, you scan the barcode of the origin warehouse. The system inserts the warehouse ID in the Warehouse box. Scan the destination location barcode . You scan the barcode of the destination location to which you are transferring items. Optional: Scan the destination warehouse barcode . If the location whose identifier you scanned in the previous step is assigned to multiple warehouses, you scan the barcode of the destination warehouse. The system inserts the warehouse ID in the To Warehouse box. The system displays an error message and cannot perform the transfer if either of the following is true: The destination warehouse differs from the origin warehouse and the warehouses are assigned to different buildings No building is specified in the settings of either of the warehouses Scan the item barcode . You scan the barcode of the item to be transferred. Optional: Scan the lot or serial number of the item . This step is required only if the item is lot- or serial-tracked. You need to scan the lot or serial number of the received item if the Use Default Auto-Generated Lot/Serial Nbr. check box is cleared on the ([~/?ScreenId=IN101000|IN101000]) Inventory Preferences (IN101000) form. If the check box is selected, the system specifies the lot or serial number for the serialized item automatically. Optional: Scan expiration date of the item . This step is required only if the item is lot- or serial-tracked. You need to scan the expiration date of the received item if the Use Default Expiration Date check box is cleared on the ([~/?ScreenId=IN101000|IN101000]) Inventory Preferences form. If the check box is selected, the system specifies the expiration date for the serialized item automatically. Optional: Scan item quantity . To change the transferred quantity in the line that is currently being processed, you switch to Quantity Editing mode by scanning or entering the *qty barcode or by clicking Set Qty on the form toolbar; you then manually enter the quantity in the base unit of measure. Optional: Scan the barcode to confirm the quantity being transferred . If the Use Explicit Line Confirmation check box is selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=IN101000|IN101000]) Inventory Preferences form, you confirm the line that is currently being processed by scanning the *ok barcode or by clicking OK on the form toolbar. Optional: Scan the barcode of the next item to be transferred between the selected locations If another item must be transferred between the currently selected locations, you scan the barcode of the next item (return to Step 6) and repeat the process for the next item. Optional: Scan the barcode of the next origin location . If items must be transferred between another locations, you scan the barcode of the next origin location (return to Step 2) and repeat the process. Release the inventory transfer . When you have finished transferring items, you scan the *release*transfer command or click Release on the form toolbar. The system releases the inventory transfer. Warehouse Operations with Lot- and Serial-Tracked Items Lot numbers and serial numbers are used to track certain types of inventory items and keep accurate records about their distribution. If the Lot and Serial Tracking feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form, you can configure the tracking of stock items by lot or serial number, as well as by expiration date. (For more information, see Lot and Serial Number Tracking.) This topic describes the specifics of processing lot- and serial-tracked items in automated warehouse operations. Picking and Packing Lot- and Serial-Tracked Items When you switch to Pick mode and scan the shipment number, the system loads the shipment lines into the table on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO302020|SO302020]) Pick, Pack, and Ship (SO302020) form. To select a line for processing, you scan the item barcode and the barcode of the location from which the item is picked. For serial-tracked items (with any assignment method), the system shows a separate line for each picked item. For lot-tracked items, the system shows the total quantity to be picked as one line and splits the line by lots. When you process the packing of items in Pack mode, for each item to be packed to a selected box, you scan the item barcode, lot or serial number, and, optionally, expiration date (which must be the same as the expiration date in the shipment). Receiving Lot- and Serial-Tracked Items When you switch to Receive mode and scan the purchase receipt number, the system loads the purchase receipt lines into the table on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO302020|PO302020]) Receive and Put Away (PO302020) form. To select a line for processing, you scan the item barcode and the barcode of the location to which the item is received. The settings of the item being received determine the item settings that you must enter as follows: For serial-tracked and lot-tracked items with the When Received assignment method, you must scan or enter the lot or serial number when receiving an item. For items that belong to a lot/serial class for which the Auto-Generate Next Number check box is selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=IN207000|IN207000]) Lot/Serial Classes (IN207000) form, the system automatically generates lot or serial numbers and displays them in the Lot/Serial Nbr. column. For items with the When Used assignment method, specifying the lot or serial number is not applicable. For items of a lot/serial class that requires the expiration date to be specified—that is, a class for which the Track Expiration Date check box is selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=IN207000|IN207000]) Lot/Serial Classes form—you must enter the expiration date. For serial-tracked items with the When Received assignment method, the system requires that you specify serial number for the item, and it splits the line once you enter a serial number for a received item. If you specify another serial number than the one that was automatically generated by the system, the system replaces the auto-generated number with the one that you have entered. For lot-tracked items, you receive each lot from a received quantity separately; the system split the lines by the received lots. When you process the putting away of the items in Put Away mode, for each item to be put away, you scan the barcode of the receiving location, the item barcode, and then the lot or serial number. Receiving, Issuing, Transferring, and Counting Lot- and Serial-Tracked Items When you receive, issue, transfer, or count lot- or serial-tracked items, for each item to be processed, you scan the location barcode, the item barcode, the barcode of the lot or serial number, and, optionally, the expiration date. During the counting of the items, you find an item with an unregistered serial number, you can add this item to the physical inventory document by scanning the item barcode and the serial number.

Cart Tracking in Warehouse Operations If the Cart Tracking feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form, you can configure cart entities, which represent physical carts used for moving inventory items within a warehouse, and track item movements between warehouse locations. Configuring Carts When the Cart Tracking feature is enabled, you can configure carts on the Carts tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=IN204000|IN204000]) Warehouses (IN204000) form. For a warehouse, you can create any number of carts. For each cart, you specify the ID and a short description, and you select the Active check box to indicate that the cart can be used for moving items. Viewing Items in Carts When you use carts in automated warehouse operations, you can quickly view the list of items in a particular cart by using the ([~/?ScreenId=IN409020|IN409020]) Storage Lookup (IN409020) form. You scan the barcode of a cart in a particular warehouse, and the system displays the list of items and their quantities in the cart. Tracking Carts in Picking Operations If the Use Carts for Picking check box is selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO101000|SO101000]) Sales Orders Preferences (SO101000) form, specifying a cart is added as a required step of picking items workflow. This configuration is used to track item movements when a warehouse worker first takes the items to a cart, and then picks them from the cart and packs for shipping. That is, a cart represents a temporary location from which the items are picked for processing. Before scanning a shipment number in Pick mode, you scan the barcode of the cart that you are going to use for picking items. The system shows the ID of the currently selected cart in the Cart ID box on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO302020|SO302020]) Pick, Pack, and Ship (SO302020) form. Then you scan the location barcode and the item barcode and specify the quantity of items loaded to the cart; the system shows this quantity in the Cart Qty. column for each line, thus indicating the items that have been loaded to the currently selected cart. To indicate picking items from the cart, you use the *cart*out command to enter Cart Unloading mode, and you scan the item barcode and quantity; the system reduces the Cart Qty. and adds this quantity to the Picked Quantity . After the items are picked from the cart, you pack and ship the items, or you confirm the shipment without packing, depending on the workflow set up in your company. For more information about picking and packing workflows, see Pick, Pack, and Ship Operations. Tracking Carts in Putting Away Operations If the Use Carts for Putting Away check box is selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO101000|PO101000]) Purchase Orders Preferences (PO101000) form, the specification of a cart is added as a required step of the workflow of putting away items. This configuration is used to track item movements when a warehouse worker first loads items into the cart from the receiving location, and then puts them away from the cart to the place of storage. That is, a cart represents a temporary location from which the items are taken for processing. Before scanning a receipt number in Put Away mode, you scan the barcode of the cart that you are going to use for putting away items. The system shows the ID of the currently selected cart in the Cart ID box on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO302020|PO302020]) Receive and Put Away (PO302020) form. Then you scan the item barcode and specify the quantity of items loaded into the cart; the system shows this quantity in the Cart Qty. column for each line, thus indicating loading items to the currently selected cart. To indicate putting away each item from the cart, you use the *cart*out command to enter Cart Unloading mode, and scan the item barcode, the location barcode, and the quantity; the system reduces the Cart Qty. to indicate the item being put away. After all the items for the current document are put away from the cart, you release the transfer document, and the processing is completed. For more information about workflows associated with receiving items and putting them away, see Receive and Put Away Operations. ([~/?ScreenId=SO101000|SO101000]) ([~/?ScreenId=PO101000|PO101000])
